story:
Project LETS

Project LETS is an inclusive community for individuals with mental illness that provides peer support services, assists with self-advocacy, and strives for political change. We approach our work through a framework of intersectional feminism and a social model of disability-- aiming to break down barriers to quality mental health care by addressing issues of stigma, discrimination, and institutional ableism. With $25,000, Project LETS will be able to expand our Peer Mental Health Advocate (PMHA) program to more college campuses, and continue to provide programming, resources, and crisis support to young folks in need. With your help, we will continue to facilitate peer support services within a variety of communities.
 

What is it like accessing mental health care services?

  • Medical model of disability is dominant and pervasive 
  • Many counseling centers are understaffed, under-resourced, and lack social and cultural competence (racism, sexism, ableism)
  • Providers contribute to stigmas against certain disorders and experiences 

The Story of LETS

In October 2009, our founder, Stefanie Kaufman, lost her friend Brittany Marie Petrocca to suicide. In the aftermath, it was clear that the East Meadow, New York community was devastated and hurting. However, her high school shut down conversations about it-- they even refused to put a photo of Brittany in the yearbook. At the age of fourteen, Stefanie and her friends did not know how to grieve in this culture of silence.

It was at this point that Stefanie, who was quietly living with her own mental illness, began to work to erase the stigma by holding educational workshops, pushing for policy reform, and encouraging conversations about mental health and suicide. In 2013, she incorporated Project LETS as a 501(c)3 nonprofit organization in the state of New York.

The Problem

Upon coming to Brown University, Stefanie soon recognized the same culture of silence around issues of mental health. She had negative experiences with mental health resources on campus-- with long wait times and a fragmented system of care, it was difficult to access help. The lack of transparent policies made students with mental illness frightened to seek care from university counseling centers. Students didn’t know if they would be involuntarily hospitalized or even forced to withdraw from school if they expressed concerns about suicidal ideation and self-harm to a therapist-- so many students struggled in silence. 

In response, Project LETS launched their pilot PMHA program at Brown University in the fall of 2015.

The PMHA Program - Our Solution

Our Peer Mental Health Advocate Program, or PMHA program, addresses the need for additional mental health supports specifically for college students. We train college students with mental illness to advocate for other students with mental illness by forming one-on-one partnerships, where they provide long-term peer support, and help struggling students access useful and culturally relevant resources.

           

  • We are the experts: When trying to solve this problem of lack of support for college students with mental illness, many people look to outsiders with specific credentials-- but we believe that a solution lies with the very people who experience the problem. They are the ones who have the expertise and the skill sets to solve it-- nobody knows these issues better than the people who are hurt by them.

  • Innovative: It is mutually beneficial for both the PMHA and the mentee. The peer counselor can help their mentee more easily navigate the mental health care system, if they so choose, and can provide them with a consistent source of social support where they can be honest about their experiences with their illness. 

  • Internalized stigma: There is immense power in that “me, too,” moment, especially when you’re dealing with a topic that so often makes people feel very vulnerable. This is really unique because so often, we’re told that our mental illnesses are only something to overcome, and aren’t anything to be proud of. 

  • It already exists: Students are already widely utilizing it, but it’s informal peer support-- meaning that these conversations are happening behind closed doors, and aren’t regulated, with people who might not be trained and who might not have ever encountered these issues before. We are not therapists, and do not claim to be; peer support is a different kind of mental health care entirely, and has been proven especially helpful for people with stigmatized illnesses.

            

The Campaign

For the past 4 years, Project LETS, Inc. has run on a very small budget. Stefanie started the organization with $3,000 of her own money. Through a few grants, individual donations, and merchandise sales, LETS has been able to fully fund our programs without any major financial assistance. We’ve provided all of our services for free. But in order to expand, we need more help.

With your donations, Project LETS will: 

  • Expand our PMHA Program to 10-15 more universities, including RISD, URI, Penn State, Yale, and Columbia.
  • Continue staffing our chat-based crisis line with peer counselors.
  • Continue to offer free, web-based peer counseling services to individuals who can’t seek treatment due to insurance complications, financial limitations, family issues, stigma, geographic location, inaccessibility, cultural differences, and many other barriers.
  • Work toward our long-term goal of opening a peer respite center + mobile crisis units, all staffed by peer counselors.

Project LETS, Inc. has elevated the voices of students and young adults living with mental illness, or neurodiverse experiences. We don’t believe in being a “voice for the voiceless” — we believe that everybody has a voice, but that many are silenced. Your contribution goes directly towards ensuring that the narrative of marginalized voices is out there, front and center. Our passion is palpable, our troublemaking is fearless, and our voices are loud and proud together in the face of adversity.

About the Team

Read more about Stefanie in the Brown University Embark Fellowship release:

Stefanie Kaufman: In this work, I come from the perspective of an individual with lived experience (psychiatric/physical disability, sexual assault survivor, suicide attempt survivor) and our team began filling a unique niche between clinical medicine and organizations focusing strictly on awareness. The medical model of disability does not provide individuals with many resources, skills, or opportunities to become empowered; so we focus on relationship building and peer support. This work is as much for my own justice and survival as it is for those that we work with and serve.

How You Can Help

  • Follow us on Facebook and Twitter throughout the campaign for updates 
  • Share the campaign link with your friends, family, and on social media 
  • Make a donation (large or small) 
  • Sign up for the Project LETS Newsletter to receive email updates

 

Campaign Acknowledgments:

Project LETS is part of the Embark Post-Graduate Fellowship, which supports graduating seniors continue pursuing their entrepreneurial goals, helps their ventures gain traction, and builds a connected alumni community. We extend our deepest gratitude to the Swearer Center, Nelson Center for Entrepreneurship, and Brown University.

Special thanks to Deb Mills-Scofield: who has been exactly what you need in a mentor, and then everything more. 

Thank you to Oscar Dupuy d'Angeac for producing our video; Anays Genemaras for her dance moves; Nia Sanders for her choreography; and Stella Akua Mensah for her powerful voice!

Upon coming to Brown University, Stefanie soon recognized the same culture of silence around issues of mental health. She had negative experiences with mental health resources on campus-- with long wait times and a fragmented system of care, it was difficult to access help. The lack of transparent policies made students with mental illness frightened to seek care from university counseling centers. Students didn’t know if they would be involuntarily hospitalized or even forced to withdraw from school if they expressed concerns about suicidal ideation and self-harm to a therapist-- so many students struggled in silence. 
In response, Project LETS launched their pilot PMHA program at Brown University in the fall of 2015.

The PMHA Program - Our Solution
Our Peer Mental Health Advocate Program, or PMHA program, addresses the need for additional mental health supports specifically for college students. We train college students with mental illness to advocate for other students with mental illness by forming one-on-one partnerships, where they provide long-term peer support, and help struggling students access useful and culturally relevant resources.
           

We are the experts: When trying to solve this problem of lack of support for college students with mental illness, many people look to outsiders with specific credentials-- but we believe that a solution lies with the very people who experience the problem. They are the ones who have the expertise and the skill sets to solve it-- nobody knows these issues better than the people who are hurt by them.
Innovative: It is mutually beneficial for both the PMHA and the mentee. The peer counselor can help their mentee more easily navigate the mental health care system, if they so choose, and can provide them with a consistent source of social support where they can be honest about their experiences with their illness. 
Internalized stigma: There is immense power in that “me, too,” moment, especially when you’re dealing with a topic that so often makes people feel very vulnerable. This is really unique because so often, we’re told that our mental illnesses are only something to overcome, and aren’t anything to be proud of. 
It already exists: Students are already widely utilizing it, but it’s informal peer support-- meaning that these conversations are happening behind closed doors, and aren’t regulated, with people who might not be trained and who might not have ever encountered these issues before. We are not therapists, and do not claim to be; peer support is a different kind of mental health care entirely, and has been proven especially helpful for people with stigmatized illnesses.

            
The Campaign
For the past 4 years, Project LETS, Inc. has run on a very small budget. Stefanie started the organization with $3,000 of her own money. Through a few grants, individual donations, and merchandise sales, LETS has been able to fully fund our programs without any major financial assistance. We’ve provided all of our services for free. But in order to expand, we need more help.
With your donations, Project LETS will: 

Expand our PMHA Program to 10-15 more universities, including RISD, URI, Penn State, Yale, and Columbia.
Continue staffing our chat-based crisis line with peer counselors.
Continue to offer free, web-based peer counseling services to individuals who can’t seek treatment due to insurance complications, financial limitations, family issues, stigma, geographic location, inaccessibility, cultural differences, and many other barriers.
Work toward our long-term goal of opening a peer respite center + mobile crisis units, all staffed by peer counselors.

Project LETS, Inc. has elevated the voices of students and young adults living with mental illness, or neurodiverse experiences. We don’t believe in being a “voice for the voiceless” — we believe that everybody has a voice, but that many are silenced. Your contribution goes directly towards ensuring that the narrative of marginalized voices is out there, front and center. Our passion is palpable, our troublemaking is fearless, and our voices are loud and proud together in the face of adversity.
About the Team
Read more about Stefanie in the Brown University Embark Fellowship release:
Stefanie Kaufman: In this work, I come from the perspective of an individual with lived experience (psychiatric/physical disability, sexual assault survivor, suicide attempt survivor) and our team began filling a unique niche between clinical medicine and organizations focusing strictly on awareness. The medical model of disability does not provide individuals with many resources, skills, or opportunities to become empowered; so we focus on relationship building and peer support. This work is as much for my own justice and survival as it is for those that we work with and serve.
How You Can Help

Follow us on Facebook and Twitter throughout the campaign for updates 
Share the campaign link with your friends, family, and on social media 
Make a donation (large or small) 
Sign up for the Project LETS Newsletter to receive email updates

 
Campaign Acknowledgments:
Project LETS is part of the Embark Post-Graduate Fellowship, which supports graduating seniors continue pursuing their entrepreneurial goals, helps their ventures gain traction, and builds a connected alumni community. We extend our deepest gratitude to the Swearer Center, Nelson Center for Entrepreneurship, and Brown University. 
Special thanks to Deb Mills-Scofield: who has been exactly what you need in a mentor, and then everything more. 
Thank you to Oscar Dupuy d'Angeac for producing our video; Anays Genemaras for her dance moves; Nia Sanders for her choreography; and Stella Akua Mensah for her powerful voice!

story:
Who we are and why?

Kennae Miller, owner of Transformation Yoga.

    Kennae was born in Frankfurt, Germany in a strong military family and was raised in Colorado Springs, CO where her father completed his military career and her family planted their roots. While living in Colorado and being exposed to many different experiences and forms of art she discovered yoga as a junior in high school. Initially lured by the invitation of a free class for relaxation as she navigated her teenage years she enjoyed the calmness of mind a yoga practice brought for her. It was only after the beginning of her parent’s difficult divorce was she able to observe and benefit in different aspects of life, from focus to self-inquisition, stemming from a yoga practice. Kennae credits the practice of yoga as the only place she could go to just be herself and relax her mind.

    In Spring 2005 she enlisted in the United States Air Force and as she traveled around the country, found stability in continuing her yoga practice. As Kennae approached motherhood in 2012, she dreamed of having more freedom outside of wearing a uniform where her individuality and desire to serve others could be of better use. She recalls in 2013 Tweeting, that she would become a Yoga Instructor and own a yoga studio. In 2015 she completed her Yoga Alliance compliant 200-hour teacher training at Hawaii Yoga Institute on the island of O’ahu, Hawaii. Since then she has continued her career development and training in Gentle Yoga, Race Based Trauma Injury, Yoga and Social Justice, Restorative Yoga, Body Positivity, Yoga Nidra, Usui Reiki and various other healing modalities of yoga and meditation. She is also a former police officer and medical assistant and the wife to Retired United States Air Force Spouse and mother of two.  

Here is what she has to share about Transformation Yoga. 

    Transformation Yoga is important to me because as much as it is not about me, I too will be able to gain access to tools to assist in my personal journey as I make it available to others. Yoga spaces have strong manufactured marketing that tells certain people and communities that yoga is not for them and this is or is not what a yogi looks like. Because of this it leaves out so many communities especially communities of color (without tokenism), bigger bodies, older bodies, and the communities that could use the tools yoga and other healing modalities have to offer. Oftentimes people are trained to believe access to something like yoga or meditation is a luxury and everyone is not privileged to it. 

    "So why don't studios make classes a price where people can afford to attend?" Between the overhead cost and expenses to run a studio (double or triple that for being in a specific area where your demographic has access to economic resources) most yoga teachers do not make a living doing this work. In fact, most yoga teachers never make $30k annually, which extends them to driving all over town to offer these tools in multiple studios and off-the-path locations just to be able to bring home a working wage. We also have to acknowledge access to capitol to open business doors, which is difficult to obtain especially if you are not what the "ideal" market tells these investors you should look like. 

    "Don't make excuses, start where you can. Try community centers, Recreation outlets, gyms." Unfortunately because yoga is a $290 billion industry everyone in some way is trying to tap into the yoga market whether that is having classes with cats, selling their own version of yoga equipment, or presenting one clothing brand over another. With so many people seeing yoga as a market for making money and having funding to market what they believe yoga to be, it is difficult for real teacher and those that live this lifestyle to do the real work of yoga. At one point I was teaching 18 classes all over town in different locations and at each place was expected to teach for free, teach for the cost of minimum wage, teach in unsafe ways and conditions and leave out the real yoga. Yes, in some locations in an effort to not offend anyone (although yoga is pretty universal) teachers are instructed to not use Sanskrit words, to not wear particular clothing, or play specific music. Would we ask a doctor to perform surgery but leave her or is brain at home and use the hospital issued one? We don't believe so, this is why we need our own space so there are no limitations on the creativity, arts, and healing that can take place. 

 

What We Need 

    We need our own facility, where our teachers are no longer running around town to offer these tools to the communities that can benefit most from them. Our facility needs to offer a space for the attendees of these communities to bring their children into the same loving and holistic environment without feeling reprimanded because they did not have access to childcare or an after school program and instead have to not attend classes. We will hire locally and utilize local and eco-sustainable products first and only out source when neccessary. 

    We need to ensure our doors will stay open. Pause for a moment and reflect on how many yoga studios used to exist here in the lowcountry and have since closed their doors. We believe in the work we are doing and the lives that are touched and transformed by each and every class we teach and offer but we also know each class is one opportunity to pull back the layers of introspection and it is important class participants are able to come back and continue doing their individual work so we can go out into the communities to serve from our healed and compassionate hearts not our ego perspectives. 

    What can you expect out of this, a community where everyone is community. Where regardless of gender identity, race background, or religious belief people can come together in their differences and celebrate our collective humanity. Transformation Yoga is and will always walk the path of being of service to the community whether in volunteering, donations, bringing accessibility to the forefront, utilizing our voice and platform to speak for others and amplifying the voice of others and listening when someone else would be better served to speak. If we do not raise enough funds, we will keep trying. We will not give up and look for something else because we are driven by purpose and service, and we know opening these studio doors is not about us, its about the people. If by an act of God, we are unable to live out this life given purpose we will donate all of the raised funds to Fresh Future Farm (go check them out). 

The Impact

    This work is so important to the collective of humanity because in times like these, crucial times we should be able to gather together for the collective voice of humanity, yet how can we do so when we are disconnected from our own hearts and belief. Somewhere many of us have sacrificed compassion and love for profits and fame which has resulted in hate crimes across the country, family separations, media bias in reporting crimes against women and the LGBTQ+, and even the #MeToo movement. We believe through the use of tools like yoga and meditation we are called to action to reconnect with ourselves and in reconnecting within taking a position of notice and action for others. 

   We are not the best at asking people to review us, we are not driven and motivated by Facebook 'Likes' or Instagram Followers but we would encourage you to find one of our students and ask them why they come back? What difference their lives have had since attending any of our classes and if you are really curious try one class and tell us for yourself. Then share that with others. We know there is someone somewhere that has far more training and certifications, who plays different music, maybe even looks different than us and wears better clothes but we are just about serving because it isn't about us. 

Risks & Challenges

    We are sure to have some challenges and are prepared to conquer them. My career in the Air Force led me into a career of meeting deadlines, problem solving, and making it happen to carry out the mission no matter what obstacles were presented and this studio would be no different. We could face competition, but this is the very least of our concern. We are not interested in taking clients away from any other studios or competing to be #1, we only want to serve the communities that WE are meant to serve. Just like churches, there are many and people can choose which resonates with them, yoga studios are the same. 

    Funding is our biggest challenge and here we are asking you to help us. We will raise enough funding to not only open our doors but to pay our teachers well, have all of our equipment, legal fees, insurance, lease, and utilities covered for at least our first year. This will allow us to focus on serving the people and solidifying our community roots to ensure we are able to keep our doors open in the following years. 

    To serve the populations we need to serve we have to be incredibly strategic in our approach. We want our doors to open in Goose Creek so we are able to serve the Cane Bay, Goose Creek, Berkeley County side of Summerville and Moncks Corner. With our doors open there we will be able to offer remote classes at a satellite location in North Charleston. This is will allow us to keep our doors open as well as offer accessible classes in the community. 

Other Ways You Can Help

    We know our mission will be in hearts and minds and some will not be able to give monetary donations but we would still love your help and support. You can share our campaign, attend any one of our classes, tell your family or friends instead of purchasing another gift, apron, or item that may not be used or re-gifted to send in a donation on your behalf.

story:
ABOUT US

I’m Katie Hess, founder of LOTUSWEI. I’ve been working with flower elixirs for the last 18 years, having started creating products 10 years ago. I’m the author of Flowerevolution + I’ve been teaching meditation + awareness practices for 12 years.

As the world’s leading floral apothecary LOTUSWEI has been featured in O, The Oprah Magazine, The New York Times, the LA Times + more.

Our goal is to bring our flower essences into worldwide awareness, so that this powerful, sustainable tool of transformation can help people everywhere lead the freest, best version of their lives.

What we know is that when prepared in a certain way, every flower on the planet has a unique effect on us as humans, and these flower elixirs are little-known, but fast-acting + effective.

Through our work, we reconnect people with their inner power, beauty + creativity using nature’s kindest remedy: flowers.

We hand-collect flowers all over the planet to make the most sustainable, gentle + effective botanical remedy for emotional wellness.

We help thousands of people around the world experience more happiness, clarity, peace + better sleep with flower elixirs, mists, oils + rituals.

LOTUSWEI is not just about bottles of elixirs - we invite you into our world of pivotal experiences and memorable events, workshops + retreats.

We’ve hosted Flowerlounges in Singapore, New York City, San Francisco, Vancouver, Phoenix, Seattle, Minneapolis, Portland, Boston, Baltimore, Chicago, Los Angeles and Philadelphia.

Flowerlounges are multi-sensory events designed to awaken all your senses so that you can let go of tension + rest in a state of beingness. Enjoy flower mandalas, flower libations + bites infused with mood-boosting elixirs, positive vibes, sparkly people and wakefulness practices.

As leaders in flower essence education, we published an interactive, choose-your-own-adventure flower elixir book and a flower card deck that demonstrate how flowers reflect your greatest potential for inner exploration. We also host the Flowerlounge Podcast with listeners in over 60 countries, featuring experts in wild + non-conventional fields of expertise.

UPLEVELING

We've purchased a commercial building that’s 8x larger than our current location. Home to our new headquarters, it’s allowing us to expand our business exponentially AND we’re creating a wellness hub in Phoenix, Arizona.

Here’s what we’ll do:

OPEN OUR FIRST EVER BRICK + MORTAR APOTHECARY:
Experience our multi-sensory products and get a flower reading that will reflect back to you what's happening in your life + how flower essences can help.

HOST FLOWERLOUNGE EVENTS + WORKSHOPS:
Attend multi-sensory events, botanical + awareness workshops and weekly meditation + tai chi classes + salsa dance parties.

PROVIDE BOTANICAL + FLOWER ESSENCE TREATMENTS:
Enjoy out-of-the-box healing techniques using botanicals, fresh flowers + an apothecary of flower essences + aromatherapy. More relaxing than a massage.

FEATURE NATIONAL WELLNESS EXPERTS AS PART OF OUR PHOENIX WELLNESS HUB:
Meet experts: Acupuncturists, Astrologers, Intuitives, Creatives, Poets, Monks + Nuns, Bodyworkers + Martial Artists.

HOST UNDERGROUND FLOWERLOUNGE "HAPPY HOURS":
Think: ‘Speakeasy’ (but it’s all legal!) for flower elixirs + personal growth with elixir-infused sparkling tonics in our tea lounge inside the LOTUSWEI lab.

THE HEADQUARTERS

Our business has previously been located in two small historic homes with guesthouses in downtown Phoenix (super cute! see below). We’ve happily operated out of four buildings on our little compound, but now we’re ready to rise like Phoenixes.

After months of research, we purchased our own commercial space and got the keys on September 6th!

Centrally-located, it’s one block north of the Melrose District, a hip, growing strip of local shops, coffeehouses + restaurants.

Our 15,000 sq ft historical building has good bones, but there are some necessary updates + repairs that are high cost. We need a new roof, a fresh coat of paint, concrete floor polish, and other improvements.

THE BIG LEAP

Our team is amazingly talented at making beautiful things + experiences.

And -- owning commercial real estate is a huge leap for us.

We’ve never been motivated by money. Our motivation has always been to bring more peace into people’s lives + reconnect them with their full potential. But in order to benefit more people, we need to take this risk.

Honestly, it's the boldest move I’ve made in my entire life. 

We’re excited to use this building to bring to life our apothecary + store, weekly “happy hours” with mood-boosting beverages and other multi-sensory events and workshops. We’ll offer botanical bodywork treatments and flower ceremonies and experiences.

WHY THIS MATTERS

We live in a fast-paced world, glued to our smartphones + computers. Over a third of us have trouble sleeping every single night. Stress is a constant, with 1 in 5 American adults on medications for stress and over 7 million kids on medications for ADHD.

Wifi signals + cell phone towers are sending unprecedented levels of electromagnetic activity coursing through our bodies, every minute.

We don’t spend enough time in nature to rebalance all of that. But flower elixirs bring nature to you.

Why does this matter? Because what we do really works.

Within hours or days of implementing flower elixirs, you experience less irritation. Life becomes smoother. Stress begins to dissolve. You sleep more soundly. Overwhelming emotions get softer and lessen. You notice a sense of perspective and relief.

Over time, you let go of relationships that don’t work, form new ones that do, open more fulfilling career paths, and do things with joy that you used to be afraid of. Resilience is unveiled, self-limiting beliefs dissolve and your talents begin to shine. Your dreams awaken. You become the best version of you.

In short, our flower elixirs accelerate the process of getting you from where you are to who you want to be.

During my international studies of flower essences, I was taught that if even 3% of the world’s population is taking flower elixirs, it will change the outcome of the future for the better.

From the beginning, that has been our goal. We intend to create a worldwide ripple effect of happiness.

HOW YOU CAN HELP

Purchase one of our packages, make a donation or purchase from our website: www.lotuswei.com

Local to Phoenix + need an office space? Rent space from us for your office or next private event.  

If you can’t contribute financially: spread the word + share on your social channels!

Visit our website for soft launch party, grand opening details + special limited edition events: www.lotuswei.com

PERKS

$10 :: Wakeful Meditation Teachings + Practices
We want EVERYONE to have this. That's why we included it in every package. A value of $108, it includes 15 audio recordings with Katie Hess: Wakefulness Method Audio Teachings + Practices. Listen on your phone anytime, anywhere. Discover what meditation is/what it isn't, why it's important and how easy + life-changing it is.

$25 :: Full Bloom Aura Mist - 30 ml
Not even released on the website yet! This formula includes the four most powerful flower essences for making the impossible possible, uncovering secret talents, experiencing a new level of collaboration + expanding into the most bad-ass version of you - the one you’ve been holding back. Infused with aromatherapy that EVERYONE loves - women + men alike: fresh citrus + herbal spice.

$50 :: Night-Blooming Cereus Flower Elixir
This flower changed my life + business overnight! A cactus flower from the Sonoran desert that blooms one night each year, this elixir helps you take a big leap toward your full potential. 

In a honey + organic grape alcohol base, our flower elixirs are taken internally + taste like nectar! You’ll also receive a gorgeous flower guide, digital wallpapers for your phone/computer + writing prompts that catalyze wisdom.

$108 :: Secret Teachings of Flowers - Education Kit
Includes: Flowerevolution Book, Flowerevolution Flower Card Deck + a 15-minute virtual flower reading with one of our lovely flower babes at LOTUSWEI.

Learn the language of flowers with our choose-your-own-adventure style book, Flowerevolution: Bloom Into Your Full Potential with the Magic of Flowers. Rich with information, stories, images, and rituals, this book features ancient + modern methods for harnessing flowers’ unique qualities, like DIY flower baths + body oils, mandala rituals, yummy recipes, and more!

Wake up your inner wisdom with our Flowerevolution Card Deck: 54 flower cards with insightful messages, 8 different visual + intuitive readings, and a daily ritual to discover which of your qualities most want to be amplified today!

Kick start your own personal Flowerevolution with a 1:1 virtual flower oracle reading + discover how the flowers you’re most attracted are a mirror of what’s happening in your heart, mind + life.

$145 :: Meditative Bathing Ritual Kit
12 single-use bath salts infused with flower elixirs + exquisite aromatherapy. Each bath salt comes with its own soaking meditation that you can listen to while you’re in the bathtub.

Includes Bath Salts from our 12 main blends: Joy Juice, Infinite Love, Fierce Compassion, Wild Abundance, Radiant Energy, Inspired Action, Full Bloom, Quiet Mind, Boundless Wisdom, Inner Peace, Gamechanger + Truthteller.

$235 :: The Ultimate Love Bomb
Our yummiest, fan-favorites: Fierce Compassion + Infinite Love! Includes: Infinite Love Mist, Infinite Love Elixir, Infinite Love Anointing Oil, Infinite Love Bath Salts, Fierce Compassion Mist, Fierce Compassion Elixir, Fierce Compassion Anointing Oil, Fierce Compassion Bath Salts. Includes two Love meditations + two Compassion meditations.

Fierce Compassion: Roses, Dirt, Liquor, Caramel. Earthy, Rich, Floral with flower elixirs for nurturing, appreciation of things just as they are, healing, overall envelopment of love and caring for ourselves + others. This is one of our most complex, unique + avant garde blends ~ we find it addictive.

Infinite Love: Nurturing Rose, Honey + Mandarin with flower elixirs for unconditional love; attract love + affection, enhanced magnetism, attractiveness + charisma. Magnifies gentleness, compassion, softness + receptivity.

$300 :: Your Own Private LOTUSWEI Smoke Offering Ceremony
Never offered before! This is the ceremony that LOTUSWEI does in every city as a blessing before each Flowerlounge. For the first time, we are opening it up to our community. Can be done in person in Phoenix or virtually. 

Guided by Katie and 1-2 other Wei-team practitioners trained in an ancient Tibetan smoke offering practice, this auspicious + transformative experience is specifically dedicated to removing obstacles from your life and inspiring prosperity, longevity + happiness.

$360 :: Flower Elixir Mixology Kit
6 Flower Elixirs + 6 Aura Mists (30mL) from our most popular blends: Joy Juice, Infinite Love, Radiant Energy, Inspired Action, Quiet Mind + Inner Peace.

We’ll also share 6 of our favorite easy-to-make drink recipes - both mocktails + cocktails - using our elixirs + mists! Delight in a joy-inducing berry fizz with edible flowers, a peace-inducing blue pea colada + other mouthwatering libations.

$1000 :: Two-hour Private Ceremony Devoted to Y O U
Private consultation with Katie, LOTUSWEI Botanical Treatment, auspicious smoke offering ceremony + flower offering ritual at the new headquarters. The benefits are countless, as the practices remove obstacles and bring together all the parts, pieces + personalities of you into a more aligned, clear + focused you.

This ceremony cleanses your energetic systems and strengthens your best qualities. It is a sacred experience & the results are profound. The only thing required is an open heart. Includes a gift of the 4-5 products or flower elixirs that will best serve you, your life + any specific concerns over the next few months. 

$1500 :: Private One-on-One Virtual Consultation with Katie
Impossible to get otherwise ~ Katie doesn’t do consultations anymore! Includes initial session, follow-up session and a luscious care package custom to your needs sent to your doorstep days later - with abundant goodies for three months of transformation.

$3000 :: Your Own Private Flowerlounge Ceremony for You + Group
Gather up to 12 of your closest friends, family or colleagues for a private Flowerlounge Ceremony devoted to your group.

Join Katie + the LOTUSWEI team at our space in Phoenix. Includes flower rituals, fresh flowers, sips + snacks, interactive group experiences + professional photos to capture the magic. Walk away from this ceremony feeling peaceful, sparkly + connected. Can also be purchased for your business as a team-building experience.

$4000 :: Wakefulness Retreat in Costa Rica
A rare opportunity to join us at our retreat in Costa Rica from November 10-17, 2018. Your lodging is located a short walk from the beach, tucked away in lush tropical gardens. Hear the sound of the ocean while you fall asleep + enjoy a beautiful room, a private porch with a hammock, one queen-size bed, an outdoor shower + air conditioning.

Also includes: delicious vegetarian cuisine all week, flower essence rituals, a one-on-one acupuncture treatment, a one-on-one luminary intuitive session, tide pool soaking, evening rituals, morning meditations, day of silence, oracle card readings, ear crystal auricular therapy, sunset gazing on the beach + time to reconnect with your most powerful self, surrounded by a dozen or so other sparkly beings. All meals + lodging + experiences covered. Limited to women only, flights not included. More info at www.earthaura.com.

$10,000 :: Your Own Private Flowerlounge Anywhere in North America
Gather up to 12 of your closest friends, family or colleagues for a private Flowerlounge Ceremony devoted to your group. Katie + a LOTUSWEI team will travel to your home or place of business anywhere in North America.

Includes flower rituals, fresh flowers, sips + snacks, interactive group experiences, professional photos to capture the magic and a private smoke offering ceremony for your space. Walk away from this ceremony feeling peaceful, sparkly + connected. Can also be for your business as a team-building experience.

 

Help us reach more people, faster! We’re so grateful for your support.

Love + flower petals,
Katie and The LOTUSWEI TEAM

 

Tme-lapse flower footage by award-winning filmmaker Louie Schwartzberg.
story_txt:
ABOUT US

I’m Katie Hess, founder of LOTUSWEI. I’ve been working with flower elixirs for the last 18 years, having started creating products 10 years ago. I’m the author of Flowerevolution + I’ve been teaching meditation + awareness practices for 12 years.
As the world’s leading floral apothecary LOTUSWEI has been featured in O, The Oprah Magazine, The New York Times, the LA Times + more.

Our goal is to bring our flower essences into worldwide awareness, so that this powerful, sustainable tool of transformation can help people everywhere lead the freest, best version of their lives.What we know is that when prepared in a certain way, every flower on the planet has a unique effect on us as humans, and these flower elixirs are little-known, but fast-acting + effective.
Through our work, we reconnect people with their inner power, beauty + creativity using nature’s kindest remedy: flowers.
We hand-collect flowers all over the planet to make the most sustainable, gentle + effective botanical remedy for emotional wellness.
We help thousands of people around the world experience more happiness, clarity, peace + better sleep with flower elixirs, mists, oils + rituals.

LOTUSWEI is not just about bottles of elixirs - we invite you into our world of pivotal experiences and memorable events, workshops + retreats.We’ve hosted Flowerlounges in Singapore, New York City, San Francisco, Vancouver, Phoenix, Seattle, Minneapolis, Portland, Boston, Baltimore, Chicago, Los Angeles and Philadelphia.
Flowerlounges are multi-sensory events designed to awaken all your senses so that you can let go of tension + rest in a state of beingness. Enjoy flower mandalas, flower libations + bites infused with mood-boosting elixirs, positive vibes, sparkly people and wakefulness practices.
As leaders in flower essence education, we published an interactive, choose-your-own-adventure flower elixir book and a flower card deck that demonstrate how flowers reflect your greatest potential for inner exploration. We also host the Flowerlounge Podcast with listeners in over 60 countries, featuring experts in wild + non-conventional fields of expertise.

UPLEVELING
We've purchased a commercial building that’s 8x larger than our current location. Home to our new headquarters, it’s allowing us to expand our business exponentially AND we’re creating a wellness hub in Phoenix, Arizona.
Here’s what we’ll do:

OPEN OUR FIRST EVER BRICK + MORTAR APOTHECARY:Experience our multi-sensory products and get a flower reading that will reflect back to you what's happening in your life + how flower essences can help.

HOST FLOWERLOUNGE EVENTS + WORKSHOPS:Attend multi-sensory events, botanical + awareness workshops and weekly meditation + tai chi classes + salsa dance parties.

PROVIDE BOTANICAL + FLOWER ESSENCE TREATMENTS:Enjoy out-of-the-box healing techniques using botanicals, fresh flowers + an apothecary of flower essences + aromatherapy. More relaxing than a massage.

FEATURE NATIONAL WELLNESS EXPERTS AS PART OF OUR PHOENIX WELLNESS HUB:Meet experts: Acupuncturists, Astrologers, Intuitives, Creatives, Poets, Monks + Nuns, Bodyworkers + Martial Artists.

HOST UNDERGROUND FLOWERLOUNGE "HAPPY HOURS":Think: ‘Speakeasy’ (but it’s all legal!) for flower elixirs + personal growth with elixir-infused sparkling tonics in our tea lounge inside the LOTUSWEI lab.

THE HEADQUARTERS
Our business has previously been located in two small historic homes with guesthouses in downtown Phoenix (super cute! see below). We’ve happily operated out of four buildings on our little compound, but now we’re ready to rise like Phoenixes.

After months of research, we purchased our own commercial space and got the keys on September 6th!
Centrally-located, it’s one block north of the Melrose District, a hip, growing strip of local shops, coffeehouses + restaurants.
Our 15,000 sq ft historical building has good bones, but there are some necessary updates + repairs that are high cost. We need a new roof, a fresh coat of paint, concrete floor polish, and other improvements.


THE BIG LEAP
Our team is amazingly talented at making beautiful things + experiences.
And -- owning commercial real estate is a huge leap for us.
We’ve never been motivated by money. Our motivation has always been to bring more peace into people’s lives + reconnect them with their full potential. But in order to benefit more people, we need to take this risk.
Honestly, it's the boldest move I’ve made in my entire life. 
We’re excited to use this building to bring to life our apothecary + store, weekly “happy hours” with mood-boosting beverages and other multi-sensory events and workshops. We’ll offer botanical bodywork treatments and flower ceremonies and experiences.

WHY THIS MATTERS
We live in a fast-paced world, glued to our smartphones + computers. Over a third of us have trouble sleeping every single night. Stress is a constant, with 1 in 5 American adults on medications for stress and over 7 million kids on medications for ADHD.
Wifi signals + cell phone towers are sending unprecedented levels of electromagnetic activity coursing through our bodies, every minute.
We don’t spend enough time in nature to rebalance all of that. But flower elixirs bring nature to you.
Why does this matter? Because what we do really works.
Within hours or days of implementing flower elixirs, you experience less irritation. Life becomes smoother. Stress begins to dissolve. You sleep more soundly. Overwhelming emotions get softer and lessen. You notice a sense of perspective and relief.
Over time, you let go of relationships that don’t work, form new ones that do, open more fulfilling career paths, and do things with joy that you used to be afraid of. Resilience is unveiled, self-limiting beliefs dissolve and your talents begin to shine. Your dreams awaken. You become the best version of you.
In short, our flower elixirs accelerate the process of getting you from where you are to who you want to be.
During my international studies of flower essences, I was taught that if even 3% of the world’s population is taking flower elixirs, it will change the outcome of the future for the better.
From the beginning, that has been our goal. We intend to create a worldwide ripple effect of happiness.

HOW YOU CAN HELPPurchase one of our packages, make a donation or purchase from our website: www.lotuswei.comLocal to Phoenix + need an office space? Rent space from us for your office or next private event.  If you can’t contribute financially: spread the word + share on your social channels!Visit our website for soft launch party, grand opening details + special limited edition events: www.lotuswei.comPERKS$10 :: Wakeful Meditation Teachings + PracticesWe want EVERYONE to have this. That's why we included it in every package. A value of $108, it includes 15 audio recordings with Katie Hess: Wakefulness Method Audio Teachings + Practices. Listen on your phone anytime, anywhere. Discover what meditation is/what it isn't, why it's important and how easy + life-changing it is.$25 :: Full Bloom Aura Mist - 30 mlNot even released on the website yet! This formula includes the four most powerful flower essences for making the impossible possible, uncovering secret talents, experiencing a new level of collaboration + expanding into the most bad-ass version of you - the one you’ve been holding back. Infused with aromatherapy that EVERYONE loves - women + men alike: fresh citrus + herbal spice.$50 :: Night-Blooming Cereus Flower ElixirThis flower changed my life + business overnight! A cactus flower from the Sonoran desert that blooms one night each year, this elixir helps you take a big leap toward your full potential. In a honey + organic grape alcohol base, our flower elixirs are taken internally + taste like nectar! You’ll also receive a gorgeous flower guide, digital wallpapers for your phone/computer + writing prompts that catalyze wisdom.$108 :: Secret Teachings of Flowers - Education KitIncludes: Flowerevolution Book, Flowerevolution Flower Card Deck + a 15-minute virtual flower reading with one of our lovely flower babes at LOTUSWEI.Learn the language of flowers with our choose-your-own-adventure style book, Flowerevolution: Bloom Into Your Full Potential with the Magic of Flowers. Rich with information, stories, images, and rituals, this book features ancient + modern methods for harnessing flowers’ unique qualities, like DIY flower baths + body oils, mandala rituals, yummy recipes, and more!Wake up your inner wisdom with our Flowerevolution Card Deck: 54 flower cards with insightful messages, 8 different visual + intuitive readings, and a daily ritual to discover which of your qualities most want to be amplified today!Kick start your own personal Flowerevolution with a 1:1 virtual flower oracle reading + discover how the flowers you’re most attracted are a mirror of what’s happening in your heart, mind + life.$145 :: Meditative Bathing Ritual Kit12 single-use bath salts infused with flower elixirs + exquisite aromatherapy. Each bath salt comes with its own soaking meditation that you can listen to while you’re in the bathtub.Includes Bath Salts from our 12 main blends: Joy Juice, Infinite Love, Fierce Compassion, Wild Abundance, Radiant Energy, Inspired Action, Full Bloom, Quiet Mind, Boundless Wisdom, Inner Peace, Gamechanger + Truthteller.$235 :: The Ultimate Love BombOur yummiest, fan-favorites: Fierce Compassion + Infinite Love! Includes: Infinite Love Mist, Infinite Love Elixir, Infinite Love Anointing Oil, Infinite Love Bath Salts, Fierce Compassion Mist, Fierce Compassion Elixir, Fierce Compassion Anointing Oil, Fierce Compassion Bath Salts. Includes two Love meditations + two Compassion meditations.Fierce Compassion: Roses, Dirt, Liquor, Caramel. Earthy, Rich, Floral with flower elixirs for nurturing, appreciation of things just as they are, healing, overall envelopment of love and caring for ourselves + others. This is one of our most complex, unique + avant garde blends ~ we find it addictive.Infinite Love: Nurturing Rose, Honey + Mandarin with flower elixirs for unconditional love; attract love + affection, enhanced magnetism, attractiveness + charisma. Magnifies gentleness, compassion, softness + receptivity.$300 :: Your Own Private LOTUSWEI Smoke Offering CeremonyNever offered before! The only thing required is an open heart. Can also be purchased for your business as a team-building experience.$4000 :: Wakefulness Retreat in Costa RicaA rare opportunity to join us at our retreat in Costa Rica from November 10-17, 2018. story:
Short Summary

Slim and Trim Snacks is launching the first-to market raw, vegan, gluten-free,  ketogenic and Whole 30 compliant cauliflower cracker that combines nutrients, flavor and texture into one amazing snack that is beneficial for everyone.  It’s made from cauliflower, sunflower, flax, pumpkin and sesame seeds as well as herbs and spices and there is absolutely no inflammatory ingredients like wheat, flour, oil, sugar, flour, grain or preservatives used in its making.   Slim and Trim Snacks’ mission is to promote health and wellness one snack at a time, and the introduction of “Classic Cauliflower Cracker” serves to bear that out.  

Contributors who help Slim and Trim Snacks - a small, under-capitalized start-up – bring this unique product to market will, in essence, help to revolutionize the snack market where products are now made that focus on both taste and nutrients and not their mutual exclusivity. Needless to say, nutritious products that taste good are a win-win for the consumer in every respect.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Slim and Trim Snacks would like to semi-automate its current manufacturing operations to facilitate the production of these unique crackers.  To scale our operations and produce the crackers in volume we need to purchase a specific machine that will cut and sheet them in large volume.   As a result, we are seeking to raise $15,000 to help with the machinery’s purchase and any inevitable retrofitting that will need to be done to make it fully functional.

The perks we have designed are all premised on promoting health and wellness.

Even though we have signed up for the option of partial funding with Indiegogo which means that we will still receive our contributions if we do not meet our goal, it will be a huge disappointment and will substantially delay the time-frame we've earmarked to bring this unique product to market.

The Impact

Part of our intent is to secure the support of the American Diabetes Association as well as the national Celiac support group for these unique crackers as they don not have any refined carbs, or grain and as a result would be a perfect snack or mini-meal for the Type 2 diabetic or individual struggling with gluten intolerance, digestive or gut issues.   It is absolutely vital that we bring this breakthrough product to market, so that it can make a meaningful difference in the healthier choices that are available on the supermarket shelves as consumers become more accepting of and are demanding greater plant-based choices.    

Though we already produce raw, vegan, gluten-free kale chips that are currently sold in select Whole Foods Market stores in the north east, that operation is very small  and with it we are pitted against many competitors in a very fragmented field where there are a few large competitors and hundreds of small ones.  By creating a unique and distinguishing, second product line like the cauliflower cracker, we intend to be the first to market with this product in an environment where consumers are demanding and seeking more nutritious snack choices.  And since we have already gotten a commitment from Whole Foods Market to retail it in their stores, we only now need to focus on the process of bringing it to market as soon as is practicable.

Risk & Challenges

The risks and obstacles we may face on the way to achieving our goal is competition and lack of capital.  If we do not raise enough funds to scale the product the way we would like, it could delay the process of scaling the product and carve out our own market share.  With that delay, we  could then face the risk of enormous market pressure from competitors.  So as a practical matter, not having enough capital prevents us from semi-automating our production facilities which is key to achieving economy of scale and allow us to exercise greater flexibility in pricing.  Therefore, the success of this campaign - that is achieving our goal - is absolutely crucial.  

Through my business partner and husband who is a mechanical engineer and who specializes in helping companies realize greater production and operating efficiency through proven methods like lean manufacturing, we believe that Slim and Trim Snacks is well-positioned to scale the brand once we have secured the targeted funding.

If we do not have enough funding to purchase the equipment that we need outright, then the contingency plan is to source and retrofit used machinery - a more time-consuming endeavor. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute to our campaign, you can spread the word.  Post to your Instagram page, tweet about us and share on Facebook to get the word out.  Tell your friends, family and contacts and ask them to tell their friends as well!

story:
note: there are several videos with more information, click the thumbnails under the main video.

A Brief Backstory

Its not often that I have put out a call for help, as my aspiration throughout this earthwalk is to serve all of you, to restore the well-being of earth's precious biosphere, and to uplift the destiny of humankind. 

As such, I have happily shouldered a weight of responsibility for greater good, and given my energy and days to endeavors that inspire me as worthy and honoring of the divinity within and beyond, efforts that vow reverence to the sanctity of life and the beautiful heart of kindness within you and I and all.

I have all too often taken upon myself to exert my body to its very limit to further my vision for humankind or that of another, often working physically at the threshold of my capacity while creating functional infrastructure and restoring ecosystems to harmony and fruition. And I have suffered multiple injuries to both knees as a consequence of the hazards I have faced, and have now used up the capacity of my knees to so much as support my body weight.
So presently I am confined to a wheelchair for mobility, unable to stand up, let alone tend our gardens, walk in nature, or climb the stairs to the  sanctuary space I so consciously created for the coming together of soul kin for meaningful purpose and sharing of wisdom, for the making of music, and co-creation of sacred devotional space.

Until now, I have never felt the opportunity to sustain a focus on regeneration of the tissues in my knee joints that have served me so well, even as I have suffered much pain for some decades as I have continued to give of myself wholeheartedly and bodily. For the past 20 years I have been riding on grace to empower my ability to mobilize upon my devotions in spite of the severity of the injuries and pain. That grace is now used up, no longer sufficient to keep me standing in my convictions in a physical sense. No longer allowing me to walk my talk so to speak.  A poignant milestone on my journey, and a fulcrum for my way of life that directs me to turn my attention inward to regenerate and heal the cartilage, bone surfaces and ligaments in my knees that have been all but used up.

Despite the challenges that my current physical limitation poses, I remain happy and inspired, deeply grounded in an inexhaustible trust in the larger vision, and in the capacity of my body to heal. I have been postponing all too long the healing process that my knees are so deserving of, as they have served me so well and I have asked so much of them. So it is really a relief that I can now feel full permission to focus my days on regenerating the tissues, and re-orienting my way of life to a more balanced, inward, and restorative energetic. 

Past Injuries and Years of Wear & Tear

Here I am in a disabled state, having suffered several severe injuries to both knees in decades past, where only partial healing occurred before returning to an active, highly physical way of life; working the land, building structures, organizing community events, and giving of myself to whatever worthy project came before me. And so as I continued my hard working way of life on damaged knees, the deterioration of the joint tissues continued, gradually worsening over the years. I have been living with ongoing pain for a couple of decades and gradually losing capacity while still staying highly active and functional, but finally I've reached a threshold where the tissues in both of my knees have deteriorated to the point where I am unable to walk. 

I'm On Track For Stem Cell Therapy

I'm so very fortunate to be positioned well for healing my knees.We an amazing orthopedic doctor here in Ecuador who offers natural regeneration therapies and cutting edge stem cell treatment. Dr. Chiriboga is a wonderful doctor, and I'm so happy to have someone with such a highly informed and compassionate consciousness leading my healing process. He has confirmed that I am a good candidate for the stem cell procedure, and he has me on a program of preparatory protocols for the lead up to the treatment. The cellular environment inside my knee joints needs to be in a receptive and regenerative state in order for a stem cell injection to take well and initiate the tissue rejuvenation, and my nervous system needs to be cleared of residual trauma from the past accidents and injuries to be knees. A couple months of neural therapy, orthomolecular intravenous antioxidants and anti-inflammation compounds, homeopathy, physiotherapy, and tissue regeneration supplements are serving to shift the energetics of my knees from acute inflammation and edema to a relaxed and receptive healing mode. In january I will receive stem cell injections in both knees. Dr. Chiriboga will extract some of my own stem cells from the bone marrow in my pelvis and also some fat tissue from my abdomen, with which he will prepare and inject the stem cell concentrate directly into the joint cavity in both knees. The stem cells, being undifferentiated and having the pristine genetic coding for every tissue in the body, will induce the deteriorated joint tissues to regrow into a healthy and youthful state.

A Year of Tissue Regeneration

The stem cell tissue regeneration, like any natural process, occurs slowly over a longer timeframe.

  • 3 months after the stem cell injections, I will return to Dr. Chiriboga to receive platelet rich plasma injections in both knees. He will extract some blood from my arm and then process it to remove the red and white blood cells, and use the remaining plasma, rich in growth factors, for the injections. This will invigorate the stem cells to continue regenerating the joint tissues.
  • 6 months after the stem cell injections, the joint regeneration is assessed and depending on the level of progress, further treatments will be scheduled. Often it takes 2 or 3 stem cell injections to recover serious joint deterioration over the course of a year or 2.
  • During the regeneration process, I will have ongoing physiotherapy to continue strengthening the leg muscles, increasing the range of motion, and get me up and walking again. Occasional sessions of other therapeutic modalities such as cranial sacral, reflexology, bowen therapy, and arun touch will also be part of my healing process.
  • Daily hydrotherapy (alternating hot & cold water) and a regimen of stretches and gentle exercises will support the tissue regeneration while increasing flexibility and strength.
  • I will also be taking various nutraceutical supplements and botanical preparations throughout the process to augment the tissue regeneration.

Transitioning Our Mode of Offerings

Suzannah and I have been hoping for an opportunity to focus our time and energy creating online educational resources. We have such a wealth of inspiring content to share, and while we love gathering folks here at Canción del Corazón center for uplifting retreat programs, it is clear that we can also extend our outreach much further by having more of an internet presence and having our retreat content in video, webinar, blog, and podcast formats so it can easily go out to the world. Our hope is that many more people will then find us and if they resonate with our offerings, they can make use of our knowledge and experience to inspire their own activation of their deeper callings.

During the coming year of my healing process, I will not be in a position to contribute to the running of the center and our usual means of income to cover our overhead and living costs in the way that I normally do. So we are needing to scale back our programs, and by doing so, will be creating time and space to move forward with our aspirations to create our online educational resources. Your contribution, in addition to helping us meet the substantive medical costs, will also be supporting us to do this work.

If you are inspired by our way of life and the offerings we share, then through supporting us to make our resources available online, you will have opportunity to receive ongoing access to them and continue to connect with us in that way, and you'll be collaborating with us to contribute the uplifting inspirations to the world.

We'll Be Forever Grateful For Your Support

Any level of generosity that you feel to offer up will be deeply appreciated and is so very kind and helpful. I hope that empowering me to walk again and giving Suzannah and I this opportunity to take our collective vision to a higher level of outreach will return unforeseen grace and opportunities toward your own soul callings and way of life.

may kindness grace your days...

Phil
story_txt:
note: there are several videos with more information, click the thumbnails under the main video.
A Brief Backstory
Its not often that I have put out a call for help, as my aspiration throughout this earthwalk is to serve all of you, to restore the well-being of earth's precious biosphere, and to uplift the destiny of humankind. 
As such, I have happily shouldered a weight of responsibility for greater good, and given my energy and days to endeavors that inspire me as worthy and honoring of the divinity within and beyond, efforts that vow reverence to the sanctity of life and the beautiful heart of kindness within you and I and all.
I have all too often taken upon myself to exert my body to its very limit to further my vision for humankind or that of another, often working physically at the threshold of my capacity while creating functional infrastructure and restoring ecosystems to harmony and fruition. And I have suffered multiple injuries to both knees as a consequence of the hazards I have faced, and have now used up the capacity of my knees to so much as support my body weight.So presently I am confined to a wheelchair for mobility, unable to stand up, let alone tend our gardens, walk in nature, or climb the stairs to the  sanctuary space I so consciously created for the coming together of soul kin for meaningful purpose and sharing of wisdom, for the making of music, and co-creation of sacred devotional space.
Until now, I have never felt the opportunity to sustain a focus on regeneration of the tissues in my knee joints that have served me so well, even as I have suffered much pain for some decades as I have continued to give of myself wholeheartedly and bodily. For the past 20 years I have been riding on grace to empower my ability to mobilize upon my devotions in spite of the severity of the injuries and pain. That grace is now used up, no longer sufficient to keep me standing in my convictions in a physical sense. No longer allowing me to walk my talk so to speak.  A poignant milestone on my journey, and a fulcrum for my way of life that directs me to turn my attention inward to regenerate and heal the cartilage, bone surfaces and ligaments in my knees that have been all but used up.
Despite the challenges that my current physical limitation poses, I remain happy and inspired, deeply grounded in an inexhaustible trust in the larger vision, and in the capacity of my body to heal. I have been postponing all too long the healing process that my knees are so deserving of, as they have served me so well and I have asked so much of them. So it is really a relief that I can now feel full permission to focus my days on regenerating the tissues, and re-orienting my way of life to a more balanced, inward, and restorative energetic. 
Past Injuries and Years of Wear & Tear
Here I am in a disabled state, having suffered several severe injuries to both knees in decades past, where only partial healing occurred before returning to an active, highly physical way of life; working the land, building structures, organizing community events, and giving of myself to whatever worthy project came before me. And so as I continued my hard working way of life on damaged knees, the deterioration of the joint tissues continued, gradually worsening over the years. I have been living with ongoing pain for a couple of decades and gradually losing capacity while still staying highly active and functional, but finally I've reached a threshold where the tissues in both of my knees have deteriorated to the point where I am unable to walk. 

I'm On Track For Stem Cell Therapy
I'm so very fortunate to be positioned well for healing my knees.We an amazing orthopedic doctor here in Ecuador who offers natural regeneration therapies and cutting edge stem cell treatment. Dr. Chiriboga is a wonderful doctor, and I'm so happy to have someone with such a highly informed and compassionate consciousness leading my healing process. He has confirmed that I am a good candidate for the stem cell procedure, and he has me on a program of preparatory protocols for the lead up to the treatment. The cellular environment inside my knee joints needs to be in a receptive and regenerative state in order for a stem cell injection to take well and initiate the tissue rejuvenation, and my nervous system needs to be cleared of residual trauma from the past accidents and injuries to be knees. A couple months of neural therapy, orthomolecular intravenous antioxidants and anti-inflammation compounds, homeopathy, physiotherapy, and tissue regeneration supplements are serving to shift the energetics of my knees from acute inflammation and edema to a relaxed and receptive healing mode. In january I will receive stem cell injections in both knees. Dr. Chiriboga will extract some of my own stem cells from the bone marrow in my pelvis and also some fat tissue from my abdomen, with which he will prepare and inject the stem cell concentrate directly into the joint cavity in both knees. The stem cells, being undifferentiated and having the pristine genetic coding for every tissue in the body, will induce the deteriorated joint tissues to regrow into a healthy and youthful state.

A Year of Tissue Regeneration
The stem cell tissue regeneration, like any natural process, occurs slowly over a longer timeframe.

3 months after the stem cell injections, I will return to Dr. Chiriboga to receive platelet rich plasma injections in both knees. He will extract some blood from my arm and then process it to remove the red and white blood cells, and use the remaining plasma, rich in growth factors, for the injections. This will invigorate the stem cells to continue regenerating the joint tissues.
6 months after the stem cell injections, the joint regeneration is assessed and depending on the level of progress, further treatments will be scheduled. Often it takes 2 or 3 stem cell injections to recover serious joint deterioration over the course of a year or 2.
During the regeneration process, I will have ongoing physiotherapy to continue strengthening the leg muscles, increasing the range of motion, and get me up and walking again. Occasional sessions of other therapeutic modalities such as cranial sacral, reflexology, bowen therapy, and arun touch will also be part of my healing process.
Daily hydrotherapy (alternating hot & cold water) and a regimen of stretches and gentle exercises will support the tissue regeneration while increasing flexibility and strength.
I will also be taking various nutraceutical supplements and botanical preparations throughout the process to augment the tissue regeneration.


Transitioning Our Mode of Offerings
Suzannah and I have been hoping for an opportunity to focus our time and energy creating online educational resources. We have such a wealth of inspiring content to share, and while we love gathering folks here at Canción del Corazón center for uplifting retreat programs, it is clear that we can also extend our outreach much further by having more of an internet presence and having our retreat content in video, webinar, blog, and podcast formats so it can easily go out to the world. Our hope is that many more people will then find us and if they resonate with our offerings, they can make use of our knowledge and experience to inspire their own activation of their deeper callings.
During the coming year of my healing process, I will not be in a position to contribute to the running of the center and our usual means of income to cover our overhead and living costs in the way that I normally do. So we are needing to scale back our programs, and by doing so, will be creating time and space to move forward with our aspirations to create our online educational resources. Your contribution, in addition to helping us meet the substantive medical costs, will also be supporting us to do this work.
If you are inspired by our way of life and the offerings we share, then through supporting us to make our resources available online, you will have opportunity to receive ongoing access to them and continue to connect with us in that way, and you'll be collaborating with us to contribute the uplifting inspirations to the world.

Any level of generosity that you feel to offer up will be deeply appreciated and is so very kind and helpful. I hope that empowering me to walk again and giving Suzannah and I this opportunity to take our collective vision to a higher level of outreach will return unforeseen grace and opportunities toward your own soul callings and way of life.

Phil

story:
Support our Purpose

The main aim of the project is to create a free online course of mindfulness to enhance Home-schooling experience in Latin America during the pandemic crisis. We like to help Latin American parents and children with advice, tips, recommendations, and exercises adapted to their social and cultural environment. The project is a way to help Latin American people to face the emotional pressure of home-schooling and child care at home, while they are facing the stress of economic and social difficulties.

 

Our Team

We are a couple of Colombians living in Madrid and very interested in education and the future of the next generations:

What We Need & What You Get

We will strengthen parenting and child education in Latin America, teaching online mindfulness practices through a website and social networks. Our main aim is to help people in Latin American cities but also remote places affected by poverty and violence. We want to assist them in integrating mindfulness skills in children's education, helping them to be more resilient, confident, body awareness, and heartfulness.

Through the free online course, Latin American parents and children could learn the basics of mindfulness meditation applied to children, simple yoga exercises for kids, mindful breathing games and short stories about emotions, all of them oriented to make the Home Schooling and the isolation experience of families more bearable and kind.

In this first crowding campaign, your monetary support is essential to finance the Design and Implementation of the Online Course.

 The steps and costs are:

If we do not reach our entire goal, we will use the funds raised to finance the very first steps of the project.

Feel you proud to help children and parents in Latin America supporting this social project!

 

The Impact

Because the course online will be designed and promoted in Spanish, it could be used also by Spanish-speaking families around the world: not only in Latin America, but also in the U.S and Spain.

This project has been ideated to seed in Latin kids a healthy relationship with their bodies, learn to regulate their emotions and to be resilient. We are thinking of future adulthood.

The course will be also an opportunity for Latin families to cultivate love-based relationships. Societies need to build more compassion-based community ties. We believe in the socialization of emotional intelligence in the long term through the diffusion of mindfulness practices today.

At large, we hope to help Latin families in the development of emotional skills, stress reduction, and improving mental and emotional stability in the pandemic era. And we would like to continue the project as a long term foundation program if our crowdfunding plans succeed.

Why support this project?:

  • We will like to offer our experience, knowledge, services, and social work to a wider audience. We want to help parents and children across Latin America in this time of crisis caused by the pandemic.

 

  • We have experience designing and implementing mindfulness courses, and designing online courses. We are experts in mindfulness for children, pedagogy, and in the Latin American societal context.

 

  • We do not have the economic resources to develop the course. We would like to get your generous support to make it real.

 

  • There are thousands of families in Latin American countries without access to modern wellbeing tools: mindfulness meditation, emotional awareness, and emotional intelligence. This situation creates more inequality and increases the social gap between North and South.

 

  • Latin American states and local governments have difficulties to offer education to the population, and mindfulness training is not included. Usually the private offer of mindfulness training is reduced, profit, expensive, and socially limited to a minority. The online offer is more common in English, and there are no free online courses of mindfulness for children in Spanish. The actual online tools for children in Spanish are not adapted to the Latin American context, suppose previous training or formation, and use a language code proper of the privileged social classes.

 

  • In Latin America, many people suffer daily different effects of poverty, including violence. Pandemic and isolation have just increased it. The project is a way to help Latin American people to face the emotional pressure of the home-schooling and children's care at home, while they face the stress of economic difficulties, also increased with the pandemic.

 

  • We believe that kids must be always the core of our concerns, solidarity actions, and social politics. They are the weakest and more exposed in contexts of crisis, poverty, and violence. Help us to start a project to help parents and teachers to build a better environment for kids' emotional health!

 

Challenges

In the process of achieving our goal, we will face some challenges, as to assure the most wider range of usuaries in Latin American countries.

We need to reach the widest audience if possible. We will use our social networks to divulge our project, but we recognize that it is a high goal. We need all your help with this task (Please, see below how to help). If we go beyond our funding goal, we will spend a percentage of the resources on online advertising.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Tell your friends, family, and network about the project and share it. As a supporter, you are an essential part of our advertiser's team. 
  • Publicizing the campaign discussing with friends about the challenge of home-schooling and the usefulness of mindfulness tools in this context. Talk and think about how could be the situation in Latin America in times of pandemic and how we could help parents and children.  
  • Contact us with your friends, relatives, and any contact that you have in Latin America. If you know people in the media, journalists, or newspaper editors, please tell them about our project and link us with them.
  • Any financial support is useful. If you can not support us right now, you can do it later in the next campaigns: Social and media divulgation in Latin America, and Lobby to achieve political commitment in Latin American local and national governments.
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you!

If you have any questions, please contact us: lore.mamafulness@gmail.com
