story:
Hello, my name is Ricci (pronounced Rikki). This is me a few years back, taking a class at the Whole Foods Culinary Center in Austin. Soon afterwards, I enrolled in Escoffier Culinary School.

Though my professional background is in digital marketing, cookery has been my passion for as long as I can remember. It's naturally how I show my love to the people I care about.

Through the years, my family and friends often made remarks about opening a restaurant. I never dreamed I'd actually do it, but after a life-altering event brought me to Corpus Christi to be closer to family, a group of people came together to help me do just that.

There was a beloved space downtown that closed a couple of years ago. I fell in love with it, mostly because it reminded me so much of Austin. A friend suggested that I open it and that is when the adventure began. I had no idea how it would work, but with lots of determination, many successes, a few mistakes and tons of passion, we created a beautiful timeline of memories (and wisdom!). The video above are some highlights of the food we created during our time at Fresh!.

My biggest focus was on bringing a higher awareness for healthy, minimally processed foods.

Let me explain.

You see, around 2002, I began reading about high-fructose corn syrup and decided to cut it out of my diet, mostly by eliminating sodas. A few days after stopping the soda, I awoke with no brain fog.

I had become so accustomed to waking up groggy, I actually never associated it with something that I might be eating or drinking.

This began my journey into reading labels. What else was I putting into my body...into my family's bodies...that might not be the best?

My voracious label reading meant hours at the grocery store. What was once a fun ritual for our family turned into hours of boredom, mostly for the kids. They began to really despise going to the store with me, but I was insatiable. I really wanted to understand everything we were consuming.

I began to wonder how we had gotten so far off track with our diet. For instance, how and why is milk homogenized? 

You mean the naturally occurring fat globules are pressure forced through a fine sieve so they are literally transformed into a substance that will stay suspended in the milk? And why? And how does that affect the way we digest it?

Ahem..rampant-lactose-intolerance...

Sorry, didn't mean to get into specifics.

There are a lot of other things I began to question and came to my own conclusions, one being, eating as clean as possible while keeping as much ultra-processing as possible out of my and my family's diet.

Fortunately, I spent many years in Austin where there was an abundance of growers, food producers, restaurants and grocery stores that provided food that I could buy and golly-gee-whiz, not have to decipher labels!

I'll stop right here because I was about to post a bunch of facts and memes about processed food, you know, to help everyone understand why I'm so passionate about this topic, when I realized, the people who don't really believe it won't be swayed by my uncanny, ninja-like Googling tactics.

So, at this time, I shall appeal to those who:

  • Do understand
  • Want to understand
  • Might not understand, but know that many of us need to make some changes to our every day eating habits

With that said, if you've ever had a taste of my homemades (I love using the term "homemades" because, Silver Linings Playbook)

Yeah, come on, Dad, be nice. Come on, she's making crabby snacks and homemades! ~ Pat

...you'd be hard pressed not to know that most of what I make is healthy, minimally processed, and without the use of microwaves. That's right, we are a microwave-free zone.

We also refuse to use:

  • High Fructose Corn Syrup
  • Hydrogenated Oils
  • Refined Sugar
  • Artificial Sweeteners
  • Non-organic breads and flour

After I lost 45 pounds in 2010, I kept it off for three years, mostly by going gluten-free. My joints swelled up and I became lethargic after eating (what I thought to be the culprit) gluten. What I later found out (after asking, why is everyone having such a problem with gluten all of a sudden?) is that it actually WASN'T the gluten, it was the PESTICIDES that were giving me the reactions.

Anyway, that's a little about me, my background and what we've accomplished so far. And we're not even close to being done •ᴗ•

With your help, not only do you get to feel good about supporting us in the food space, you'll also get some prizes that are on fleek.

Ya, I said it.

So, are you ready?

Well, come on down!

story:
Get off the couch by sitting on the couch--Future You will give you a nudge

Due to unsafe neighborhoods, lack of resources, rural areas, mobility challenges, illness, stigma and, a litany of other obligations, it is increasingly difficult take care of you... My company Future You wants to provide services to people that want to talk with a professional but have real obstacles preventing them from doing so...

You can be analyzed from just about anywhere you choose. Instead of finding time to get to your therapist's office, pay for parking, showing up already stressed etc, you can receive services without the aforementioned hassles...and with no overhead of paying for an office; I am able to keep my rate affordable.

I have a Doctorate in Clinical Psychology and am a licensed therapist. For the past decade I have worked with impoverished chronically mentally ill adults living in mental institutions. I have also taught University level Abnormal Psychology and Personality Disorders.

My style is witty, provocative and, I think more like a Chess versus Checkers player.  I generally do not require copious amount of details to understand the whole story...Yes, great as a therapist, rather annoying for my friends.

I need contributions to get up and running efficiently and to purchase the technology, hardware and software to sit on YOUR couch with you.

I am in the process of joining a few platforms (Talkspace, BetterHelp & Breakthrough).

In the meantime I am open for business.

BTW is anyone else thinking that in the movie “The Lobster" he did not do as he claimed...? Also that "Black Mirror" and "Napoleon Dynamite" occupy too much of your mental space. 

Population Served: Adults only 18+

Session Duration: 45 minutes

Video Conferencing: Google Hangouts etc

Electronic: Email, IM

Mobile: iPad, telephonically

Payment: PayPal and Chase pay

Credentials: Doctorate in Clinical Psychology, Clinical License 

Protection:  Malpractice insurance

Confidential: All sessions are confidential and protected under HIPAA

 

Reminder: Suicide is a permanent solution to a temporary problem

story:
You don't have to quit. Just stop smoking POISONOUS Cigarettes!

Cigarettes are made up of thousands of chemicals, including at least 70 carcinogens known to cause cancer. Not to mention heart disease, lung disease, or other serious health problems. We all know its a fact - they are horrible for you.

We understand the psychology; your tense, your mind is shifting, you step away for a smoke. After a few long even puffs your heart rate comes down, your taking deep relaxing breaths and the tension lifts. You also have a few free moments to bond and chit-chat with friends and loved ones while grabbing a quick smoke.

We don’t want any of that to change, we just want to help SAVE YOUR LIFE

cDistro offers the best smoke, vape, and head shop related products to retailers and consumers in North America. Our mission is to offer a healthy, more natural, alternative to cigarettes. Our hemp pre-rolls or hempettes contain no nicotine or harmful carcinogens and are made from 100% natural, federally legal, hemp of the highest quality.

Hempette Starter Kit

Our goal is to have these amazing products available for sale in every convenience store, gas station, liquor store, smoke, vape, and head shop, etc. Basically the #1 alternative to cigarettes available anywhere cigarettes are sold.

We have assembled a sales force of 20 independent street sales reps in different cities and need $150,000 in funding help add reps to expand across the U.S.

We Like To Share

We felt that the best way to introduce this new product to the market would be to give it away to as many people as possible for FREE.

Choose any 1 or all 5 packs and we will ship them to you immediately for the cost of shipping and handling.

Risks & Challenges

SAVING LIVES is a bold goal. We feel that the biggest risk is to not have enough resources to spread the word and make our hempettes widely available. Our team will leverage our expertise using online advertising and social media to hopefully recruit passionate users of the product to help us amplify our message.

Other Ways You Can Help

If your not a smoker please forward this campaign to someone you love that is. You may also be interested in purchasing one of our apparel products at cDistro.com/Shop to help out. We appreciate the opportunity to serve you. Thank you!

story:
A Sense Of Urgency

Since beginning the book, the need which it seeks to address has become painfully clear. Last month, I attended the funeral of one of my army colleagues. He died too early having taken his own life.

During the short space of time since I commenced the crowdfunding campaign, unexpectedly, I too have had my own struggles unrelated to writing this book, and have relied heavily on the help of the veteran network as I found myself in position best described as having the wheels falling off and needing the help of others. This ironically gave me an opportunity to effectively road test this book which I can say with confidence is based on lived experience of myself and others.

Coming back from loss and the journey towards recovery takes time. It takes hard work, discipline and commitment. But it is possible. This book is empathetic to that journey and at the same time very practical in how to get back into the game and live your purpose.

A New Approach To Mindfulness

At its heart, this is a health book which considers our wellbeing as a holistic journey. Mental health is a very important aspect, which thrives when we maintain our physical health as part of this equation. To live your purpose is to live fully. You deserve it, and the world needs the best you can bring. 

This book is focused on a new approach to discovering your strength through mindfulness. I have drawn upon advice and input from some of the best teachers and leaders that I know, and I hope that you might allow me to share this with you.

The book highlights the importance of mental health as a fundamental foundation upon which to live fully, supported through three pillars of health, transition and belonging.

Changing The Trend - Inflection Points 

One of the lessons I have learnt is that if as little as 10 minutes a day is dedicated to the work of restoring yourself towards living your purpose, over time you will be amazed at your progress. 

The idea of the book is grounded in a sequence of what I am referring to as 100 “inflection points”. An inflection point is a change where a trend goes from the negative to the positive. Applying focus and momentum to this process of inflection points, this book is a toolkit for finding and living your purpose providing a very practical 14 week journal to enable change for the better. 

The framework of these inflection points is what makes this book different. They are tested and proven to have a positive impact, and my hope is that they will help you and those you most care about to improve your own wellbeing and live your purpose fully.

Encouraging Reviews

Reviews from earlier drafts to the book have been extremely encouraging, such as "Beautifully Written - Great Insight”.

I’ll let their words speak for themselves with a brief summary of some of the feedback received: ”Refreshingly frank - will touch a lot of people" 

"Makes one want to keep reading!" 

"A grand endeavour" 

"Leaves the reader wanting more" 

"This was amazing" 

"Love it" 

"Relevant" ...and many more echoing support for the work.

How you decide to use the book is up to you, as it designed with a versatility to be suitable as an elegant coffee table book featuring a photoessay to complement the writing as much as it is also a personal diary. Importantly, the substance of the book delivers a practical handbook of tested ideas to help you to Live Your Purpose.

The premise of the book “Live Your Purpose: On coming back from loss” is that we don’t need to live our lives at sea, as it were. A better life awaits, and we should strive to live that life.

Creating a resource that will help others is an end worthy of itself. My sense from the feedback I have received to date is that it will be of benefit to many. If this book helps you in some small way, then my toil will have been entirely worthwhile.

A Marathon Journey

The origins of this book was a marathon journey, literally, which culminated with the running of the Marine Corps Marathon last year in Washington DC. Many stories came from that experience which feature in the book.

I’m drawing upon the experiences of others to highlight the utility of the book to illustrate how different people in different circumstances have met the challenges of adversity, uncertainty and vulnerability that resulted from loss. 

A little about myself - From Soldier To Social Entrepreneur

My name is Matt Jones. I am a retired Australian army officer and veteran. I enjoyed my service with the Australian Army which was lengthy and with such a varied range of experiences that are too great to list here. I have never spent much time talking about my time in Defence with my civilian friends, but it strikes me that when questions are asked, the focus is often on the big ticket items, and not the lived day-to-day experience. It is understandable that people would want to hear about adventure, excitement, danger, intrigue and controversy. But in reality, it is often the day to day grind that was the most meaningful part of my service in Army.

I’m not going to pretend it was perfect, because it wasn’t. But there were good times. The best part of Army service is unquestionably the people. It is always the people that make a difference, and for me it was an opportunity to work alongside many of Australia’s finest - the men and women of the Australian Defence Force.

Speaking for myself, after leaving the ADF I must admit to having been ‘at sea’ for many years. It is a jarring contrast with my life in uniform, and for the most part a secret and unseen struggle that few people were witness to as a result of my military service.

In the years after leaving Army, I turned my attention to making impact through running as a way of addressing key matters of social change that I thought were important. I 2009, I ran what I called the 9 City Bridge Run where I ran nine sub-marathons in nine cities across five countries as a stunt to open a conversation asking how resilience and wellbeing might be a counterpoint to depression, anxiety and suicide following the tragic deaths of a number of friends.  I don’t know how successful I was in undertaking that endeavour, but this book is the culmination of that effort which I had perhaps naively self-funded back in 2009.

The idea to write this book originated while reflecting on the Marine Corps War Memorial in Arlington following the Marine Corps Marathon in Washington D.C. last year. I ended up running the marathon following the suggestion of a friend during my participation in the 22 Push Up Challenge. For those who aren’t aware, the 22 Push Up Challenge sought to raise awareness of the unacceptably high rates of suicide among the veteran community. I ran the marathon as part of a team supporting US charity The Mission Continues which seeks to empower veterans adjust to life at home to find purpose through community impact. For me, that experience was profound.

A significant event that shaped my thinking was in part the consequence of insights from running the marathon. In April this year, it dawned upon me that I was struggling with an anxiety condition and not actually coping very well. I decided to make this public knowledge as a way of finding a path to my healing. Through that process, my good friend Greg Read suggested that I consider expressing my experience through art, and the result was the award winning tapestry “I Require Assistance” borrowing the symbol of the maritime signal flag describing the same message.  

The genesis of this book is based on my own reflections, but this book is not about me. It is about us all. I’m inviting you to be part of this conversation.

Pompey Elliott Veterans Forum

One of the ways to support veterans in crisis is to engage the veteran community in dialogue. In Australia, a missing piece to this conversation is what I’m referring to as the “Veteran-Civilian Dialogue”. For too long, we have focused on respectful ceremony and wreath laying but not on actually talking to veterans who live amongst us in our community. 

I’m proposing to address this using the book as a platform to convene the inaugural Pompey Elloitt Veterans Forum in 2018 focusing on engagement of local government and business. The forum will focus on enabling this ‘veteran-civilian dialogue’ in the service of improving community wellbeing. Pompey Elliott was among Australia’s most renowned wartime generals from the First World War who, as a Major-General in 1931, committed suicide. His death is a tragic remainder that these issues are not new, and that even the most capable leaders are not immune from needing help from others.

 

Different Ways To Support 

Here are some of the other ways you could invest in this project other than purchasing a copy of the book:

Recognition

Every contributor to the crowdfunding campaign will have their name included in the book “Live Your Purpose: On coming back from loss” as a thank you for helping to make this initiative possible. If you prefer to remain anonymous, that is fine too.

Soldier’s Five

In the Army, a “Soldier’s Five” describes an abbreviated briefing containing only the essential information needed for someone who needs to act decisively under exacting conditions of extreme pressure. This Soldier’s 5 is no different, providing a practical précis emailed to you daily for 100 days across a 14 week period to use as a quick-reference resource of the essential elements based on the 100 inflection points contained within “Live Your Purpose: On coming back from loss”. 

Mind Your Head - Plus 10 Audiobook

The Plus 10 Audiobook delivers a collections of recorded guided meditations to promote your wellbeing through a greater awareness of mindfulness complementing the 100 Inflection Points upon which the book Live Your Purpose is based. It is about you giving yourself the best of you and the best of your time for ten minutes a day.

Live Your Purpose: the book

The core focus to the crowdfunding campaign, a beautifully designed health book and personal diary containing a toolkit with substance to help you Live Your Purpose.

You can elect to purchase the book for yourself, or gift a copy to benefit veterans in crisis. During the campaign, updates will be made about the progress to gift copies of these books and once bundles are gathered enabling gifting.

Give One, Get One

Elect to invest in two books, one for you and another for a mate. A companion set that allows for opening a conversation, or even gifting one book or both books to veterans in crisis. 

Restorative Fitness

Physical fitness and mental fitness are intertwined on many levels. Both are very important, and critical for us to live our best life. Investing in a Restorative Fitness Session with Matt Jones, a qualified Personal Trainer (Certificate IV Personal Trainer, with qualifications extending to restorative needs of Special Populations [relates to people recovering from injury and illness], pilates, AquaAerobics, boxing) to talk through your plan for your own restorative fitness. Conducted by phone or in person, depending on location, at a time most convenient to you. A copy of Live Your Purpose is included to help inspire you to action based on the Inflection Points.

Workshop - The Courage To Continue

Invest in a workshop tailored to meet the needs of 20 people which includes copies of “Live Your Purpose: On coming back from loss” for each participant. Delivery will be conducted using appropriate medium if transport costs are excessive. The cost of the venue and food/beverages are not included. A workshop can also be gifted to be delivered through a reputable organisation supporting the needs of veterans in crisis. 

Supporting The Pompey Elliott Veterans Forum

Government agencies, businesses or individuals can support the Pompey Elliott Veterans Forum as part of an engaged network committed to improving community wellbeing.

Sponsor the Pompey Elliott Veterans Forum

This is an invitation to become the sponsor for the Pompey Elliott Veterans Forum as they are conducted throughout 2018. Further discussion as to what this entails is welcome through contacting Matt Jones directly.

The Publishing Process

I am publishing the book in Korea working with an outstanding designer who is highly respected internationally. There are two key advantages for the process of design, production and distribution of the book in Korea. The quality is of a high standard, and through my contacts the process is more affordable than elsewhere. Additionally, the cost of postage in Korea is very competitive and exceedingly more affordable than Australia Post.

Raising A Battalion (Of Books) For Deployment

Through the sale of the book during this crowdfunding campaign, my aspiration is to “raise a battalion (of books) for deployment”. My aim is that together, we can deploy this battalion of 500 or more books to engage a much needed conversation about our mental health and wellbeing so as to generate positive impact. 

When selecting a book to purchase you have the option to receive a copy of the book for yourself or otherwise gift it to a pool of books that will be gifted to veterans in crisis who are unable to purchase a copy but might most benefit from the book. Gifted books will be distributed through reputable organisations delivering excellent programs for veterans, often on a small scale and unseen by the media. They are mostly led by seasoned veterans who draw upon their own experiences. Through contributing gifted books, it helps them to engage with veterans in crisis at the point where maximum impact can be generated through conversation, care and camaraderie. As bundles of gifted books are accrued during the campaign, they will be gifted to organisations and this will be communicated with supporters. Accountability and transparency are essential.

Funding The Book

I’m funding this book through pledges to this crowdfunding campaign you are reading now. The way it works is that by pre-purchasing a copy of the book “Live Your Purpose: On coming back from loss”, together we can fund this book and make it available as a resource to many.

The book is available here for US$25 plus postage.

All of the risk is on me as this is an “all-or-nothing” crowdfunding campaign. If I am unsuccessful in achieving the amount, all of the money is returned to those making pledges. I receive nothing unless the campaign is successful.

I appreciate that not everyone will be in a position to contribute. If that is you, thanks for reading, and I really value your being part of this journey. You too can make a difference by forwarding this link on social media. Thank you for your support.

I’m seeking to raise $9075 which is the amount needed to cover essential costs in raising this “battalion of books”.

All funds received are directed towards the production and distribution of this book so as to meet the two core objectives of creating a resource for veterans in crisis, along with engaging the veteran community through a robust veteran-civilian dialogue.

You can see the breakdown of costs outlined below:

 

One of the strengths of crowdfunding is that it requires the collaboration of many to make the outcome possible. I can’t achieve this outcome on my own. Neither is it achieved through the top-down appointment by a large institution. This reflects the conversation that is necessary in our communities about the challenges of mental health. It is up to us and it involves the collaboration of many people. Every contribution matters, no matter how small.

Two points to note on the pie chart above regarding the breakdown of costs.

Firstly, all funds received to achieve the funding goal go directly toward achieving this mission of a resource for veterans in crisis, and secondly through the conversation that ensues to engage the veteran community in a robust veteran-civilian dialogue. There are no commissions or salaries paid from the funding received.

Secondly, the crowdfunding fees might seem steep, and no one likes to pay fees. These fees are taken directly by Indiegogo prior to the distribution of funding should the goal be successful. Click here to see a link on the Indiegogo site explaining the breakdown of fees.

The Challenge

I have made crowdfunding objective for this project “all-or-nothing” which in simple terms means that if I don’t reach my entire funding goal, then no contributions will be made by anyone but neither will the book be published.

The objectives for the campaign are directly linked to the funding goal. If the entire goal is achieved, the book will be funded and the project will go ahead. We can have impact if the funding goal is reached.

If the funding goal is not reached, all funds will be returned through Indiegogo with none being received by myself. I will only receive funds from the project in the event that the funding goal is achieved, and then only after the campaign concludes in line with the dispersement policy timeline.

Through the campaign, I am striving for maximum impact. The more books that are sold, the more impact that can be generated through this conversation. To that end, I’m looking for innovative ways of broadening this conversation that will deliver impact. If you have a good idea, please let me know. 

The Impact

Many of the lessons that are included in the book come from insights shared on social media during the 22 Push Up Challenge and training for the Marine Corps Marathon last year. There has been benefit in sharing those insights, however these lessons need to be compiled and not lost, hence the book.

On a personal level, this endeavour has been entirely worthwhile, even if it has taken up a considerable among of my time and energy. As much as the impact I have experience might be worthwhile, this campaign is not about me.

The impact that might be achieved through the “raising of a battalion (of books) for deployment (about 500 books)” is the stimulation of hundreds of opportunities to help improve the wellbeing of many individuals and communities. In reality, this is a modest achievement compared to the impact that could be generated through the production of this book over the long term.

The intention is to open a broad-reaching conversation involving local governments and businesses that will frame a much needed veteran-civilian dialogue which I am referring to as the Pompey Elliott Veterans Forum. That forum is but on avenue towards bringing a new approach to mindfulness. This new approach to mindfulness draws upon lived experiences and lessons from the community as a whole through which a much needed alchemy can be generated. 

Perhaps the impact of that is sought is best communicated through the word “Restoration”, articulated superbly through words of a friend, American thought-leader, activist and author Paul Hawken: 

“The act of restoration involves recognizing that something has been lost, used up, or removed. To restore is to bring back or return something to its original state. This can involve rebuilding, repairing, removing corruptions and mistakes; it allows for the idea of bringing a person or place or group back to health and equilibrium; it can mean returning something that originally belonged to someone else, whether it is returning lands taken from other cultures, or dignity stolen by bureaucratic regulations and officialdom; it emcompasses the idea of reviving and rejuvenating connections, relationships, and responsibilities. Honor can even be retrieved. It can be as simple as replacing what has aged and died away. Above all, it means to heal, to make whole, to reweave broken strands and threads into a social fabric that honors and nurtures life around it. To restore is to make something well again. It is mending the world. People have to believe there will be a future in order to look forward.”

This act of restoration applies to us all. We have to weave a stronger fabric where veterans are very much part of the communities where they live. 

Risks

Perhaps the biggest risk I face through this campaign is sharing my personal stories of loss publicly, which requires me to overcome my own sense of shame and embarrassment. During the research for this book, I have read widely, including the author Brené Brown whose work on shame, vulnerability and trust is compelling. What I have discovered is that through embracing vulnerability I stand to encounter strength despite the risk involved. Of course, this involves exercising trust to combat shame, and as Brené Brown writes ‘you are only as sick as your secrets’. Through this process I am forced to confront the reality of my journey which at times has taken me to places I never expected to visit. 

Another challenge I face is not to attribute my own value from the success or failure of the crowdfunding process to realise this book. The book is about serving others through addressing a challenge confronted by many. By accepting this challenge, I demonstrate the ability we have to try things that may result in short term failure. Both innovation and creativity are grounded in the process of failure, and only good can come from pursuing success in this crowdfunding campaign.

“During the crowdfunding process, I will be looking after my own wellbeing as a priority by maintaining a good routine of sleep hygiene, yoga, meditation, diet, water intake and exercise. In addition, I will exploring this theme through conversations and counselling with friends and professionals alike. I will be tasting my own medicine.” I wrote those words prior to the beginning of the crowdfunding campaign, shortly after which I found myself struggling on a number of levels. It has been a good and a humbling process to accept help as it has been offered, often in circumstances that have necessitated me to put the focus on the crowdfunding on the back-burner. The point is that whatever falls across our path, there is always a way forward. Find the courage to continue. Live Your Purpose.

Please help me to live my purpose by supporting this book.

Sharing Is Caring

Please share information about this campaign through social media, to the traditional media, in conversation with your friends, and with your local library. The sharing tools on this site make that very easy. Thank you!

This is an important conversation for us all. Please open this conversation with your friends.

Thank You

There is one thing left to say and that is that I appreciate you being part of this conversation. Thank you.
story_txt: A Sense Of UrgencySince beginning the book, the need which it seeks to address has become painfully clear. Last month, I attended the funeral of one of my army colleagues. He died too early having taken his own life.During the short space of time since I commenced the crowdfunding campaign, unexpectedly, I too have had my own struggles unrelated to writing this book, and have relied heavily on the help of the veteran network as I found myself in position best described as having the wheels falling off and needing the help of others. This ironically gave me an opportunity to effectively road test this book which I can say with confidence is based on lived experience of myself and others.Coming back from loss and the journey towards recovery takes time. It takes hard work, discipline and commitment. But it is possible. This book is empathetic to that journey and at the same time very practical in how to get back into the game and live your purpose.A New Approach To MindfulnessAt its heart, this is a health book which considers our wellbeing as a holistic journey. Mental health is a very important aspect, which thrives when we maintain our physical health as part of this equation. To live your purpose is to live fully. You deserve it, and the world needs the best you can bring. This book is focused on a new approach to discovering your strength through mindfulness. I have drawn upon advice and input from some of the best teachers and leaders that I know, and I hope that you might allow me to share this with you.The book highlights the importance of mental health as a fundamental foundation upon which to live fully, supported through three pillars of health, transition and belonging.Changing The Trend - Inflection Points One of the lessons I have learnt is that if as little as 10 minutes a day is dedicated to the work of restoring yourself towards living your purpose, over time you will be amazed at your progress. The idea of the book is grounded in a sequence of what I am referring to as 100 “inflection points”. An inflection point is a change where a trend goes from the negative to the positive. Applying focus and momentum to this process of inflection points, this book is a toolkit for finding and living your purpose providing a very practical 14 week journal to enable change for the better. The framework of these inflection points is what makes this book different. They are tested and proven to have a positive impact, and my hope is that they will help you and those you most care about to improve your own wellbeing and live your purpose fully.Encouraging ReviewsReviews from earlier drafts to the book have been extremely encouraging, such as "Beautifully Written - Great Insight”.I’ll let their words speak for themselves with a brief summary of some of the feedback received: ”Refreshingly frank - will touch a lot of people" "Makes one want to keep reading!" "A grand endeavour" "Leaves the reader wanting more" "This was amazing" "Love it" "Relevant" ...and many more echoing support for the work.How you decide to use the book is up to you, as it designed with a versatility to be suitable as an elegant coffee table book featuring a photoessay to complement the writing as much as it is also a personal diary. This new approach to mindfulness draws upon lived experiences and lessons from the community as a whole through which a much needed alchemy can be generated. Perhaps the impact of that is sought is best communicated through the word “Restoration”, articulated superbly through words of a friend, American thought-leader, activist and author Paul Hawken: “The act of restoration involves recognizing that something has been lost, used up, or removed. To restore is to bring back or return something to its original state. This can involve rebuilding, repairing, removing corruptions and mistakes; it allows for the idea of bringing a person or place or group back to health and equilibrium; it can mean returning something that originally belonged to someone else, whether it is returning lands taken from other cultures, or dignity stolen by bureaucratic regulations and officialdom; it emcompasses the idea of reviving and rejuvenating connections, relationships, and responsibilities. Honor can even be retrieved. It can be as simple as replacing what has aged and died away. Above all, it means to heal, to make whole, to reweave broken strands and threads into a social fabric that honors and nurtures life around it. To restore is to make something well again. It is mending the world. People have to believe there will be a future in order to look forward.”This act of restoration applies to us all. We have to weave a stronger fabric where veterans are very much part of the communities where they live. RisksPerhaps the biggest risk I face through this campaign is sharing my personal stories of loss publicly, which requires me to overcome my own sense of shame and embarrassment. During the research for this book, I have read widely, including the author Brené Brown whose work on shame, vulnerability and trust is compelling. What I have discovered is that through embracing vulnerability I stand to encounter strength despite the risk involved. Of course, this involves exercising trust to combat shame, and as Brené Brown writes ‘you are only as sick as your secrets’. Through this process I am forced to confront the reality of my journey which at times has taken me to places I never expected to visit. Another challenge I face is not to attribute my own value from the success or failure of the crowdfunding process to realise this book. The book is about serving others through addressing a challenge confronted by many. By accepting this challenge, I demonstrate the ability we have to try things that may result in short term failure. Both innovation and creativity are grounded in the process of failure, and only good can come from pursuing success in this crowdfunding campaign.“During the crowdfunding process, I will be looking after my own wellbeing as a priority by maintaining a good routine of sleep hygiene, yoga, meditation, diet, water intake and exercise. In addition, I will exploring this theme through conversations and counselling with friends and professionals alike. I will be tasting my own medicine.” I wrote those words prior to the beginning of the crowdfunding campaign, shortly after which I found myself struggling on a number of levels. It has been a good and a humbling process to accept help as it has been offered, often in circumstances that have necessitated me to put the focus on the crowdfunding on the back-burner. The point is that whatever falls across our path, there is always a way forward. Find the courage to continue. Live Your Purpose.Please help me to live my purpose by supporting this book.Sharing Is CaringPlease share information about this campaign through social media, to the traditional media, in conversation with your friends, and with your local library. The sharing tools on this site make that very easy. Thank you!This is an important conversation for us all. Please open this conversation with your friends.Thank YouThere is one thing left to say and that is that I appreciate you being part of this conversation. Thank you.

ABOUT

Short Summary By RaptureSoft.Inc

 A Registered Female Lead Corporation In The Bronx New York & The Creators Of "BlackApp", A People-Tech Company Focused On Sociopolitical Matters Seeking To Diminish Societies Most Complex Issues Using Software.

Our Goal

We Need You Help! The BlackApp Needs Your Support In Order To Be Created, Help Us Raise 5,000 & This Campaign Will Remain Active Forever Our Campaign Can Be Indemand & This Indiegogo Web Page Will Always Be Up For All To See Where The Funds Go & How The Funds Grow. RaptureSoft.Inc Needs More Than 5,000 & We Believe We Will Help Us Keep This Fund Raising Page Up & Availbale By Raising 5k.

The Black App Is Not Another Social Media Platform This Is Not Social Media This Is Social Life.

The Black App Offers 7 Core Components:

• News Feed-Two Slide In Views, Multiple User Interface Options. (Social Medias In A Nut Shell)

• Financial Platform- Access To Financial, Legal And Local Benefits And Services.

• Education Platform-(Learn, Teach, Share, Grow)

• Media Platform-( All The Multimedia You Want All The Features You Need-  Become A Self Made Superstar)

• Services Platform- (Group Economics Made Easy - Become A (Multi-)Business Owner In Seconds/Get Employment In Half The Time)

• Encounter Space Game-(Mass Community Adhesiveness-Community Over-Watch Tools)

• Emergency Services-( Real Life Safety & Real-Time Protection Tools)

 

What We Need & What You Get

We Are Seeking Donations For Final Platform Production & Servers To Host Our Platform For You The User.

Every Pledge Reward Includes:

A Pro Membership Removing All Advertisements From Users Interface.

In Game Perk Points -  For Use In The "EncounterSpace" Communication Game.

BlackApp Product Documentation - Detailing Apps Functions & Features, A Full Color Illustration With Photos.

You Will Receive The Rewards Listed & Pledge Rewards May Include More Gifts As Time Goes On Please Check This Page And Social Media For Updates.

We Are Not Offering Equity Or Shares In The Company!!!

 

The Impact

  • Donate To Our Cause Today And Be Apart Of Our BETA TESTING PROGRAM". Tell Us What The BlackApp Is Missing And How It Should Look With This Early Access Offer Is Only Available Through The Crowdfunds Listed On Indiegogo.com And GofundMe.com.
  • Contribute To This Campaign Or Make Any Other Donation To RaptureSoft.Inc On Behalf Of The BlackApp Social Network And Be The First Of Many To Join The Network With Additional Perks And Goodies That Will Enhance Your Experience.
  • Our Platform Is Global & With Your Help We Can Finally Bring Life To BlackApp A Social Network To Life.
  • This Application Was Create By The Urban Community And We Will Not Fail The Communities We Serve. If You Cannot Donate But Like Our Campaign & Please Share Our Project With Everyone You Know Word Of Mouth Is A Power Tool & Without Your Support We Cant Begin To Change The World!

Risks & Challenges

Challenges Exist For Software Are Primarily Development Cost.

Marketing Is A Potential Challenge/Hurdle However With Your Support & Energy We Can Share The Word To The Entire Nation And Even The World!

Risk Mitigation

There Are Some Potential Risks When On The Topic Of Product Development & Platform Release. Experiencing These Top 3 Risks Listed Below During Development Or Product Release Are Unlikely! However Errors & Faults In Development OR Short Comings Of Proper Funds To Develop Could Affect Platform Product Release.

Top Risks:

Inherent Schedule Flaws

Programmatic Risks

Budget Risk-

Its Important That We Share This Campaign And Work Together To Get It Funded!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Please Use IndieGogo.Com And GofundMe.Com To Fund Our Kickstarter Campaign Is No Longer Available

story:
WHO WE ARE


Hello, how are you? My name is Brandi.  I am a 42 year old mom to a boy that was born with some medical conditions that requires continual assistance in life. He was born with ADHD, OCD, ODD (Oppositional Defiance Disorder) which makes him very busy! So why not throw in some Down Syndrome! My 16 year old son, Braedyn,  is a 'super high functioning’ teenager who loves sports and taking pictures, but pines to make some friends. 

However, not all children fit at school,  and because my son struggles daily to find his identity in this world, he's been "dismissed" from most things that children are allowed to partake in like public school and special olympics. And since there is no place to hang out daily in our community, we'd like to change that and create a place. 
 
WHAT WE WANT TO DO

We're tired of living in a lonely world. So, we'd like to share our daily life activities with others and enjoy the laughter! We'd like to make long lasting memories and create a safe, comfortable day space for people with disabilities in our community. Currently, most special needs adults hang out at the local, low-end department store, since there is nothing ‘to do’ in this town. There is no space dedicated to just people with special needs. So, we want to offer a safe, fun environment, providing the necessary social skills one requires to feel valued in this world. People with disabilities just want to be accepted for who they are. For that is what we all need in life, to feel secure and belong somewhere.
We want to bring CO-OP housing to our town of Campbell River. So the thought process is to build the two together. Those who would want to live in this CO-OP model would be apart of the special needs adventure center. 

SOME BACKGROUND INFORMATION

In addition, this past year, our family got to experience the Canadian national housing crisis. An actual lack of housing forced our family of 3 with special needs child, into my parents 5th wheel on their lot, for eight months. Our local Member of Parliament even referred to our family on September 25th, 2017 in the House of Commons when she spoke about her bill C-325 (An Act to amend the Canadian Bill of Rights regarding a right to housing.) 


In our search for a sustainable and affordable rental home, I came up with the idea of having a village of small cabins. (Edit: originally it was yurts, until someone told me a story about a bear crashing through the living room, so we've decided to promote a more permanent structure.) The spin is that we’d have a CO-OP rental village made up of ECO friendly- family orientated - adventure housing, and operate as a day farm for persons with special needs. We would share our lifestyle, because we know first hand how lonely the world really is when you have a person with special needs to care for. We could help a diverse crowd by providing them with a unique yet rewarding living adventure.

I have spoken with our pediatrician and my own physician about this idea. They think it's a great plan and very much needed here. I was told they would "refer" to us. 

WHAT WE WOULD DO WITH YOUR DONATION

We do require a land purchase or a donation of land. We would need to build the cabins. We would need to build a barn, commercial grade kitchen, workshop(s), and garage. We would need to purchase enough fencing material for a secure perimeter fence.  

WHAT LIFE WOULD LOOK LIKE ON THE FARM

Imagine horse back riding, hiking mountains and walking trails, ATVing, tinkering with cars, wood working, stamping leather, gardening, cooking & baking, reading a book near the pond. Plus, having access to pottery & art lessons, singing & music inspirations, athletics, bonfires, picnics and way more! 

WHAT YOU WILL RECEIVE

*A quarterly newsletter, once we are up and running.
*A t-shirt, a pen, a tour of the facility.
*Your name on a recognition wall on site, if you wish.
*Satisfaction of knowing that you have made a huge difference in the lives of others.

Please join  me to help other people live life to their fullest potential!  Thank you so very much.

story:
With THELMA:

  • We can find our average / "normal" check-in status.
  • Data is correlated to find the triggers that make us feel better or worse than normal.
  • We can share this data with our healthcare providers (with the added benefit of helping to show we aren't crazy).

Building Technology to Work for Us:

According to the Merriam-Webster Dictionary, a flare (or flare-up) is a sudden appearance or worsening of the symptoms of a disease or condition.  There are hundreds of symptoms across the multitude of chronic conditions.

For some of us, it may feel like we are constantly in a flare.  It can be hard to remember if we felt better or worse yesterday... two weeks ago... a month ago... two years ago.  One thing we can do with THELMA is figure out what our baseline, or "normal" is. Then, we can take a more active role in trying to heal if we know what things make us feel better or worse.

In building THELMA, we've been looking at ways to better identify the things that trigger flares for those of us with chronic conditions.  We are looking for ways to make it suck less to have a chronic condition.

We are not doctors. We are not medical professionals. We are people who, like you, have been profoundly affected by chronic conditions. We don't have the background to try to cure chronic conditions, but we do have the understanding and experience with data and technology to be able to find correlations and identify trends and triggers.

     

     

    Contributions will:

    • Allow the team to continue building THELMA.  There are bills to pay even when people working on the application are donating their time.  And, we can greatly accelerate our schedule if we can compensate people.
    • Provide opportunities for feedback, beta testing, and shaping THELMA.  Contributors will be invited to participate in testing of the THELMA prototype as well as testing opportunities throughout development. We need your help to make THELMA amazing. 
    • Keep downloads of the THELMA application free.  We are committed to making sure everyone who needs THELMA can use THELMA.  Our plan is to never charge for downloading the THELMA app.     
    • Some Perk levels, offer prepaid secure cloud storage for THELMA data.  We will have in-app purchases in the future (specifically, secure cloud storage) that will make it easier to keep your data long-term.

     

      Our iOS compatible Prototype is entering Beta Testing.

      NOTE:  THELMA is not a medical device and is not a diagnostic tool. THELMA is data correlation application.

      The THELMA Prototype is iOS compatible. 

       

      We have planned 3 Phases for THELMA:

      All Phases will focus on maintaining and improving core features, including:

      Ease-of-Use

      • Reminders with notifications to check-in.
      • 1-Step check-in capability.

      Data Correlation and Analytics

      • Information/data gathered from other applications in the background (i.e. activity/fitness, weather, sleep, travel, heart-rate sensors, food/medication trackers, etc.).
      • Optional, expanded check-ins to self-report additional information (i.e. stress level, changes to medications, sleep quality, etc.).

      Shareable Visual Representations

      • Reports and charts with actionable data about individual trends and triggers that can be shared with medical and support teams (only sharing data chosen by user).

       

      We are running a "Fixed" funding campaign - if we don't reach our funding goal, we don't collect any money.

      Funds raised during this campaign will go to paying expenses for the development of THELMAtech mobile application, cloud hosting, administrative fees, branding, outreach, conferences on medical technology, and marketing. 

      Additionally, we will donate 10% (after fees) of funds we receive to non-profit organizations that are doing great things for people with chronic conditions.

       

      Because THELMA is such a relevant and compelling endeavor, we have been able to attract amazing talent who are contributing their time and resources. The only problem with people donating their time is that their paying, day jobs (often) take priority. Our biggest risk, therefore, is completing planned development efforts by our target dates. On the flip side, if we exceed our funding goal, we will use the funds to accelerate our development schedule.

      There is, of course, the risk that we will not achieve our funding goal. That would make us very sad because we really want to make the world a better place. And, we think the way we can do that is to bring THELMA into the world.

      There is also the risk of dramatically exceeding our goal with the potential for significantly more active users during the phases than we have planned. If this happens, we will need to rapidly scale up staff and services. This would be a wonderful problem to have.

       

      We think the best way we can thank you for supporting THELMAtech is to build an amazing app and get it to you as quickly as possible. We also know that everyone needs a little inspiration now and then. We are creating stickers based on our social media outreach so you will have something to show off your participation in building THELMAtech.

      (Stickers are great for when you need a little inspiration and for sharing inspiration with others.)

      We totally get it. Not everyone is in a position to contribute monetarily to THELMA. We still want you to be able to participate and help us make THELMA truly amazing. 

      Whether or not you are contributing to this campaign, please help us spread the word to others who would benefit from THELMA. There are links (at the top of the campaign) to our social media. And, our website is a great resource to see what we are doing and share information:  https://www.thelma.tech/

      Thank you so much.

story:
Who we are

We at Karate City are all about helping others. Our mission is to impact millions of underprivileged kids and to elevate awareness in NYC and around the world. We aim to help our students choose more meaningful and productive lives. We are educating our students to make ethical and proactive decisions. We teach our method of Karate by using a professionally designed athletic program that is inspired by the world’s most prestigious and competitive athletes and their coaches.

Igor Dyachenko is the founder of Karate City. He is the world-renowned developer of virtual learning programs to be used in physical education for children, parents, and government institutions. Igor’s passion for helping children in Foster Care stems from his experience when he arrived to New York City alone at the age of 17 with no English knowledge and no financial resources.

We want to provide children in the Foster Care system with access to a vital kind of education-- one that promotes brain development by building positive neural connections, and establishes optimism and the urge to learn.

The facts

Over 400,000 American children are in Foster Care. This occurs when families are in crisis and are unable to take care of them. Unfortunately, foster children many experience disadvantages and have a much higher rate of setbacks throughout their lives than non-foster children.

  • 1 in 5 children who age out of the Foster Care system will become homeless.
  • 40% of these children will not graduate high school.
  • 7 out of 10 girls who age out of the Foster Care system will become pregnant by the age of 21.
  • 1 in 4 children who age out of the Foster Care system.

Our solution

We help children to live to their full potential by reactivating their core values, moral principles, self-discipline, confidence, and healthy habits. We provide them with practical knowledge taught by world-class instructors using the most innovative programming. 

Our process

We have three stages.

First, we conduct inspirational workshops and classes to ignite the children’s interest at the Foster Care centers. Approximately 4,500 children will be taught by world-class instructors.

Second, we select 1,000 children from the first stage and provide them with transportation to our facilities, as well a Karate City t-shirt, baseball cap, professional gloves, a duffel bag, and a uniform. The uniform has a belt with a sticker where they can track their progress. In this stage, we prepare them for tournaments. This will involve around 5,760 hours of classes.

At the third stage, the children will have full scholarships to charter schools, the opportunity to travel to international competitions, and the credentials to become a coach in order to give back to other children.

Our mission is to impact millions of underprivileged kids and to elevate awareness in NYC and around the world. We aim to help our students choose more meaningful and productive lives. We are educating our students to make ethical and proactive decisions. We teach our method of Karate by using a professionally designed athletic program that is inspired by the world’s most prestigious and competitive athletes and their coaches.Igor Dyachenko is the founder of Karate City. story:
Change a Teacher's Life With Better Mental Healthcare

We're in a national mental health CRISIS, with teacher's at the front lines.  The situation continues to worsen as students prepare to go back to school, most for in person instruction, in the midst of the upheaval of the Delta variant.

I'm Anja Dunphy, founder of Leaf Mental Health.  We are a concierge service that is passionate about getting people connected with the right mental health professional for their unique situation. 

Over the past year and a half, teachers, across all levels of instruction, have been left with the enormous and overwhelming burden of maintaining education standards during the stay-at-home orders, with little to no additional bandwidth to access the emotional support they need. If teachers decided to renew their contracts for the 2021-2022 schoolyear, they did it with hesitancy, and knowing the year may bring additional unexpected challenges. Not only are they are teaching children whose parents may have fears about in person learning, but many teachers themselves have concerns about the health risks of being exposed to so many (unvaccinated) children in a classroom.

Leaf can help.

The global pandemic is taking a toll on our teachers who are overwhelmed, struggling with burnout, experiencing anxiety, or depression leaving a lasting impact on EVERY CHILD they come in contact with.

The long-term negative effects this will have on our children are unknown. What we are seeing now is how our children are taking these negative emotions home to their families. This issue effects every family with young children in school.  I vividly recall the tears and the pain my first and third grade daughters felt when they needed help and their teachers were too overwhelmed to attend to them.  The instructors were clearly doing the best they could given the circumstances- their anguish was palpable-  as they were doing all they could as they struggle to support the kids in a way that was needed.  Compounding matters. As a profession, the suicide rate for teachers is consistently above the national average (source: 2019 CDC study). 

Our process to help is easy and effective:

  1. We have a brief meeting with the client to understand their specific needs.  We ask questions like do they want to use their insurance coverage?  What issues do they want to address?
  2. We search a national database of therapists who are accepting new patients
  3. We interview the strongest matches and check credentials
  4. We connect the individual with the best therapist for them who has availability to meet.

Using this process, teachers will easily be able to the get care they need to return to the happier life they want and deserve.  

Funding and Incentives

This campaign will fund getting 5,000 K-5 teachers faster, better mental healthcare so they and all the families they serve can lead happier, stronger lives.  For every community that raises at least $1,000 for this initiative, a teacher will get access to this service at the rate of one teacher per $5 raised. So once you hit the threshold amount, 334 teachers will get this service with an additional teacher added for every additional $5 over $1K.

Our goal of $25,000 will provide services for 5,000 elementary school teachers for one year, including the technology and staff needed to dedicate support to them.

In addition to supporting teachers in getting the help they need, we will provide research and reporting to understand which teachers are higher risk and provide them the necessary services to help them thrive. This data will allow school districts all over the country to provide more effective mental health resources to their faculty.

What You Get:

The service will be offered to teachers in cities with at least $1,000 in contributions to this project.  This will help the teachers in YOUR area. The number of teachers will be calculated at $5 per teacher. For example, if Chicago residents contribute $1,500, then 300 Chicago teachers will receive concierge mental health service.  We will work with the local school board in each city or county to engage schools and teachers fairly and equitably.

Contributing $50 or more, we will plant a tree in your name or the name of a loved one.

Contributing $250 will get you and members of your household access to three months of Leaf's concierge service.  Getting the right therapist is as easy as having a 20 minute phone call with us to determine your needs, even if you are looking for specialty care.

Contributing $500 or more will get you and members of your household access to a six months of Leaf's concierge service. Members of the household include partners, children, and other dependents and there is no limit on the number of therapist matches we'll do on your behalf.

Individuals contributing $1,000 or more, in addition to guaranteeing your city or county’s teachers will be awarded the service, will also get you and members of your household access to a FULL YEAR of Leaf's concierge service. Members of the household include partners, children, and other dependents and there is no limit on the number of therapist matches we'll do on your behalf.

 

The Impact

You're changing the world!  Teachers have a direct impact on every child in their room.  When they’re able to be happy and focused, they share that feeling with the kids.  When children are happy, they are more engaged, learn more, and come home in a better frame of mind.  It not only changes their day, but yours.  A typical school year has around 180 days, which means there are 180 times a teacher’s state of mind will change your day as a parent.   

There are lots of resources for teachers and school staff to get support, but it can take weeks or months to find the time it takes to access them.  We will quickly and easily connect them with mental health professionals who are right for them so they spend less time looking for help (or worse- not getting it because they don’t have time to look) and more time focused on what they love.

A little background on Leaf Mental Health….

Leaf was established in 2019 to connect people with the best mental healthcare possible.  After the frustrating, expensive, and time consuming trial and error process of looking for the right therapist for myself, I decided to create a way to make it easier. 

Most people don't know what kind of therapy they need or where to look for therapists who are available to help them.  They don't know how to "interview" therapists to see which is the best one for them.  How could they?  This method of feeling your way through the process with no real guidance is how most people (unnecessarily) are forced to look for help. It often wastes precious time in calling therapists who aren’t taking new patients, wastes money seeing providers who aren’t the right fit, and ultimately delays people getting into effective treatment.  Or worse- they may get frustrated and give up.

At Leaf, we are experts in using technology and expertise to take the time and guesswork out of finding treatment for individuals and their families. Imagine, instead of months of searching and not finding help, you could just make a phone call and a well trained professional will do the leg work for you?  Our teachers are with our children day in and day out, shaping their minds, guiding their development, and teaching them now to socialize. Our children are our future. It’s imperative that we make sure our teachers are up to the task of providing them the care, support, and guidance they need to become thriving members of our society and happy, well balanced people. 

It can truly be that easy, and your support will make it that easy for the teachers who shape the lives of our children. In these trying times, now more than ever, we need to come together as a community to support them and let them know how important they are to us, our families, and our future. Using this platform for funding allows them to get access to help faster.  

 

Contribute whatever you can, any amount  you can give is incredibly helpful, make sure to spread the word to others!  Together we can not only improve teachers' mental health, but our children's as well. 

Follow us on Instagram or Facebook for updates on the campaign!  @LeafMentalHealth

story:
What I am proposing:

We are living in a new paradigm of heightened necessity to pay attention to mental and physical wellbeing.  We are ushering in another age of Aquarius, an opportunity for different structures that look at healing and wellness in a new way. My business focuses on using nature's elements with a primary focus on water to release, renew, rejuvenate both mind and body. The current state of mental and physical health in America is at a critical point, western approaches to mental health are failing or at best cannot keep up with the demand for services, and western medicine application of prescribing medications is not addressing the route cause of illness, our stress . Our central nervous system remains in a constant state of fight or flight and cortisol levels raised exhaust our adrenals leaving us susceptible to a host of various stress borne illnesses, anxiety, depression, obesity, auto immune diseases, heart disease and cancer to name a few plaguing our society. The goal of Artemis Water sanctuary is first, before doing anything is, to be, Drop out and drop in. To take ourselves out of mind chatter and body stress by engaging the parasympathetic nervous system or the rest and digest functions of the body. Hot and cold water contrast therapy is how. Welcome to the newest modality, a private water wellness circuit. I have created a space defined by the five elements, living moss walls, fire, stone, wood and water. 

 The wellness circuit offers you two hours either alone or with one other person, clothing optional, to float between a traditional dry sauna, a traditional Japanese Ofuro soaking tub (6 feet X 4 feet wide),  a cedar ice bath, a sitting rain shower and a radiant heat river rock bed (ganbanyoku). The object? Disconnect, do nothing, release to the water all that does not serve you, be renewed let the medium of water we were all born from and are mostly made of restore you. 

At the  beginning or at the close of your private water wellness circuit be invited to have further healing through Thai bodywork, a movement therapy class and finally lay fireside and drink from the water bar of single sourced waters from around the world curated specifically for their health benefits, mineral content and life force. 

What is Contrast Therapy?

The Turks, Russians, Finns, Romans and Japanese have all used the idea of contrast therapy, transferring the body from very warm temperatures to very cold temperatures, as part of a regular health and wellness routine. The theory behind contrast therapy is simple—the heat from a hot sauna, soaking tub, or hot stone bed brings blood (and its nutrients) to the surface, which can soothe pain and ease sore muscles, then shocking the body in a cold plunge, which in most modern bathhouses remains at about 50 degrees Fahrenheit, increases circulation and pushes that nutrient-rich blood back into the body’s core. Contrast therapy works on the concept of vasodilatation (which occurs in the heat) and vasoconstriction (which occurs in the cold). This results in alternating the blood from flowing to the internal organs and extremities, which help reduce swelling, inflammation, enhance your sleep, improve circulation, relieve depression and provide an overall sense of wellbeing. There is also some exciting evidence coming out about the positive effects on the nervous system, contrast therapy reduces cortisol and resets the central nervous system, placing our over taxed fight and flight response back to the rest and digest mode to allow for immune system building and reduction of stress hormones in the brain not to mention better digestion tract function. 

How the circuit works

Step 1 :

Reception the Five Elements and Water Bar 

The space invites you in with expansive northern light exposure, the sound of a trickling brook, living moss walls, wood interiors, a live fireplace, an overstuffed rich emerald hued sofa, a movement space, and our single sourced water bar. 

Check in and receive your bathrobe and instructions on how to best utilize your time for the contrast water therapy circuit. Enjoy the living moss walls, fire place and resting lounge with  a complimentary glass of Masaru Emoto water, while taking your first few breaths, allowing the elements of nature to begin to let your shoulders release. 

Water Bar

What is a water bar? We are made up of 70% water, 80% when we are born and by the time we reach 70 it drops to around 60%, never the less we are mostly water this is the main point. Water is our life force, without it we cease to exist, with high quality water we increase this life force. This is called our chi (chee) the life force which sustains us. Water is not all treated equally, it has become a source of great study, the effect of water on the body depending on it's mineral and dissolved solids make up. Water from a glacier, and water from a mountain spring contain very different properties, different trace metals, minerals and acidity levels. We have taken water and what it can do for you to a scientific level at our water bar consulting with a water sommelier, yes a water sommelier,  we have curated a menu of waters from far and wide across the globe to address deficiencies and work optimally to increase your life force.

 Dr. Masaru Emoto was one of the first individuals to conduct a scientific experiment on the power of positive words versus negative criticism or bullying words on glasses of water over time. He wrote a book and published these studies called, The Hidden Messages in Water. Dr. Emoto's study took bottles of water and taped pieces of paper with words of praise on some and words of criticism on others and taped the words facing the inside of the bottle. These bottles were frozen and the crystallization of the water in each of the bottles repeatedly formed beautiful symmetric crystals in the positive intention bottles and disorganized "ugly" crystals in the bottles written with criticism and mean words. The intentions we have and the words we use hold power to change how an individual looks and feels and Dr. Emoto's experiments are the physical manifestation of this. At the water bar we will offer complimentary Emoto water imbued with various intentions for each month, filled with reverse osmosis water, messages inscribed on the surface of the glass jars and amethyst crystals.

Contrast Therapy Water Circuit

1.  Japanese  seated rain shower, first things first, get clean before soaking, then you can use later as a cold rain to aliven brain synapses after your long hot soak.

2. Soak in our imported Hinoki Cedar tub built for two, melt away tension. 

3. Cold Plunge Cedar Tub, lower down into our 52 degree 4 foot cold plunge barrel for up to  3 minute intervals..

4. Explore movement and dry heat in the Finnish dry sauna, with ambient scent of wood.

5. Aid digestion and muscle recovery on our Ganbanyoku traditional heated stone beds

Repeating this circuit for the two hour period in increasing time intervals will heal the body of inflammatory issues and mental and energetic balancing will naturally occur. 

 

Before or After choose from a treatment or individualized practice:

Movement Space

There are many ways to heal, to restore, to rejuvenate, movement is one such way. Explore various individualized  movement and contemplative modalities in the movement space. 

Highly certified and world renowned teachers share modalities of:

contemplative practices of meditation, mindfulness, journaling, health coaching,  physical practices of  tai chi, qi gong, vinyasa yoga, Budokon, yin yoga, ashtanga,  EFT  organic body flow and  energetic practices of reiki, negative energy clearing, chakra balancing, crystal bowl sound therapy and light body healing. These are not large group  classes but rather individualized practices with a common goal of exploring movement, contemplative practices and energetic modalities  appropriate to your specific physical, emotional and mental needs. Physical practices to be effective are not a one size fits all, our teachers are healers working with all aspects of the body from the physical to the spiritual in the above mentioned modalities. 

 

 

 

Thai Bodywork

 

“It feels like I can breathe again, like there is more space in my body”

What is Thai bodywork? It's not a traditional massage but meridian energy work and physical manipulation of the body to create space and freedom of movement. It is a healing technique that was practiced before doctors. The manipulation involves deep massage and stretching and it happens on the floor on a firm mattress or a mat fully clothed. It is a therapeutic procedure that provides relaxation and restores healthy blood circulation. It also treats energy blockages, weak, dysfunctional organs, aches and pains, stress and tension, flexibility, paralysis, nerve problems and postural alignments. Thai bodywork differs from traditional massage by its use of body's energy line system, known as Sen lines. There is a basic theory that there are seventy-two thousand Sen lines that are also called energy lines that line the frame of the physical body. The sen lines corresponds with the Chinese acupuncture medications and the ancient medicine practice from Indian Ayurvedic. A session typically lasts an hour or maybe more and the massage works to stretch the entire body. The massage may include the pulling of toes, fingers and ears. Thai Massage is ideal for everyone as the sessions are customized for each individual with their body type and age.

 

 

 

What I need :

I am looking to raise $80,000 towards a build out that will cost  $130,000- $150,000.

I am also looking to create a scholarship fund for teens suffering from poor mental health due to the pandemic's remote learning and isolation. You choose how to donate.

Contributions towards specific items will garner a donation plaque honoring by name the donor and pre sale appointments at a 30% reduced price for contributors.

Specific costs are:

Hinoki cedar tub built and imported from Japan : $10,000

Northern Canadian Cedar Ice Bath : $3,000

Ganbanayoku hot stone bed : $3,000

Dry Sauna: $7,000

Living moss walls : $1,500

Ethanol Fireplaces : $4,000

Architectural Antiques water bar from our friends in Northern Liberties: $4,000

Relaxation Sofa, Maker & Son  : $7,000

Wood construction : $30,000

Bathroom remodel : $16,000

Steel Beam support : $20,000

Electric : $8,000

Hvac and Hot water : $20,000  

Plumbing : $15,000

The Impact:

Our world has shifted, the need for preventive immune system building and stress reduction is more necessary than ever before but our traditional methods  of gyms and  community spas are not always available to us in this new paradigm. We need to create new structures that offer support to mind and body to keep us healthy in these increasingly more stressful times. 

This is one such structure, consider yourselves early adopters of  ancient modalities of healing in a new private and contactless environment. We are suffering, your contribution will bring the availability of these stress reducing, immune building modalities to Philadelphia even under a lock down. We are classified as "personal services" which is the same classification as a doctor's office, we can and will remain open. We service one person or 2 who live together at a time, exclusively.  

Risks & Challenges:

We all face complications that are unknown, building costs vary, availability and time lines for building are also factors for all who are creating new ventures in this time.  The opening date could be shifted by months not weeks, the cost of wood could climb again or the availability of plumbing components and as such the financial buffer to complete this project comfortably is how to ensure it gets done and this invaluable service can be offered. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I would like to offer a scholarship fund for teens suffering from the isolation of remote schooling who's mental health has been severely compromised at an age when developmentally they are emotionally more reactive,  we are seeing anxiety, depression and suicide rates soar. The traditional inpatient and outpatient mental health services are overwhelmed and wait times for beds are too long. This modality of healing bringing cortisol levels down provides a physical and emotional euphoria, it actually stimulates oxytocin and endorphins in the brain, the "happy" hormones.  Please see perks, to understand how you can contribute specifically to this fund.
