story:
Summary

Greetings: 

I hope that you are finding some peace in these troubled times. My name is Dannah McKellar Ntaka, and I am a medical researcher and founder of The Campus of Care Healthcare Corporation. The Campus of Care is a public health and medical research institute that is committed to pelvic and hormonal research studies for women of all ages and ethnic backgrounds. No woman is too young or too old to participate in the McKellar Longitudinal Women's Health Study (MLWHS). We are concerned with the technological and clinical aspects of solving problems like infertility, osteoporosis, fibroid tumors, maternal and infant mortality, HPV,  Zika, and other emerging viruses an their effects on the whole woman. 

But there is another concern that continues to show up as our subjects anonymously report in their monthly biological health journals: toxic stress. Increasingly, over the past five years, we have seen women report their concerns over gun violence, police brutality, and ethnic profiling. As researchers, we have tracked the correlation between these concerns and health outcomes such as mental health diagnoses, hypertension, and exacerbation of other chronic illnesses. 

As I entered the year 2020, both personally and as a business leader, I made a conscious decision to help others cope with loss. This year is the third year of the tragic death of my eldest son, Toivo Kotyi Ntaka. Our family and friends were devastated by the untimely death of T. Kotyi Ntaka, who was a brilliant young man. Kotyi was an entrepreneur, having acquired his first triplex apartment building and was diligently remodeling each unit. Kotyi was a self-taught chef and expressed an interest in baking at the age of two when he donned his chef's hat and attempted to make cookies in our kitchen floor when we turned our backs. Kotyi was a linguist (spoke three languages), and was a compassionate advocate for the homeless and troubled young men. Kotyi was an officer in the Latin Club while in high school and helped me tutor medical students in differential equations when he was still in high school. He is sorely missed by our family, friends, and the community her served. I especially miss him since we always shared our birthday week in August.

Or company launched the Grief Management Conference Call as a way to help more people cope with grief and find a new normal. Prolonged and unsupported grief can lead to poor health outcomes. Even before the emerging SARS-Cov-2 pandemic and the subsequent economic disaster for many families, we expanded our grief conversations to include:

Loss of Income

Loss of Normalcy 

Loss of Employment

And Loss of Marriage.

Then add the pandemic, continued murders of unarmed citizens, and civil unrest to our current lives. People are hurting across the country: of all ages and races. Citizens of the world are expressing outrage. The Campus of Care Healthcare Corporation is raising funds to heal people through our Grief Management Calls. We are planning virtual dinners with those who are struggling to cope, trips to museums and historic monuments, and the purchase of grief journals and books with powerful messages of hope. 

Here is what we need and what we can offer you!

We are seeking to raise $3,000 for the other ongoing development of our classroom at our DeSoto, Texas location. We need new digital white boards and overhead projectors. We also need to purchase journals and grief books in large quantities for the participants of the group. These materials will assist our therapists. Some of our participants have experienced multiple forms of grief and trauma and have never sought professional help.

Even if we do not reach our entire funding goal, we will still be able to purchase some needed tools to expand this grief workshop. 

As a perk for any gift of $20.00 or more, we will send you one of our 6-layer custom made, industrial masks. These masks are comfortable and stylish and have an interior filter, as well as a pocket for an additional disposable filter. 

You may also collect a mug from the sporting team of your choice as a token of our appreciation. 

Gifts of over $50.00 will receive a tote made of high quality material. These totes may be used to carry books or files. 

No gift is too small. We know the power of serving and being supported by the village. The Campus of Care Healthcare Corporation serves clients who have means to pay, as well as those members of the community who are underserved and may not have financial means. For this reason, we are asking the community to help us help the underserved during these troubling times. Our impact through our own company credit has already been impactful. Our normal means of raising funds for our growth is through hosting programs in the arts. Due to social distancing and quarantine, we have already canceled two opera concerts. Upgrades in our digital equipment for our conference room and classroom will enable us to offer concerts and public health lectures while abiding by social distance rules. 

We are a public health institute that teaches CPR, disaster preparedness, mitigation, and recovery. Our Master Development Plan has a disaster plan that has allowed us to pivot instead of being crushed by the pandemic. We are dedicated to remain in business in good times and in difficult ones. Science and technology go hand in hand, and we are willing to evolve and explore new ways of reaching our goals. As a company that relies heavily on lunches, brunches, excursions, and dinners to do capital improvement campaigns, we have pivoted to a digital format in an amazing way. We always relied on Zoom, but have increased our Zoom meetings from 5 per week too 5 per day. We are indeed committed.     

We know that their may be challenges in fundraising right now with so much economic certainty.    

There are many ways that you can assist us! Please share this site. We would love for you to tell your friends and family who may be experiencing grief of their own. We truly believe that we are in this recovery together. The Campus of Care has built the type of infrastructure through our public health education format, that can be an asset to our community. Please view our website to learn more about our initiatives. Thank you for the time you have taken to familiarize yourself with our institute.

story:
Hi everyone!

Here's the short story...

Yoga is a gateway for many people to connect and understand the power within themselves. I am one of many who have felt the healing impact of yoga and mindfulness and have felt called to share it. I'm enrolling in Yoga Teacher Training and need a little support funding it. Through this experience, my academic knowledge of mental health and insight on healing, my goal is to share this mind-body practice to those who may find it to be inaccessible or exclusive and am committed to support equitable access to wellness. Please support by donating or sharing this campaign. To show my gratitude, each donor will receive a gift (redeem them in the perks section) and if by chance, we exceed the goal, I will donate to an amazing organization with a similar mission.

With love and gratitude,

Alyssa

Follow me on IG @alyssalilia or visit alyssalilia.com to connect.

Here's the long story...

At a young age, I was exposed to healing through my grandmother. She would "hilot" us through massage. It was one of her many trades. Sometimes, she would read my palm and give me insight. She taught me to dance, cook and simply to live life with meaning and take care of one another. When she passed, I was 17 and in college.  I grieved in ways that weren't healthy for me. And the cliche of "when it rained, it poured" manifested itself. My long term relationship ended and I lost my job within months of each other. That's a lot of emotions for anyone, let alone someone who just transitioned into adulthood. I had family support, friends, and ways to positively cope but my traumas seemed to haunt me including past experiences I had no idea I needed to deal with. In retrospect, this time in my life was the catalyst for my healing journey to truly begin. When I went home to spend time with family, I enrolled in a community college during summer break and was immersed in a beginning hatha yoga class. While I expected a physical practice, I did not expect the emotional and spiritual influence that it would have on me. The guided practice and the holding of our postures inspired reflection, heart-opening, truth and self-healing. All of which I've been craving ever since. The journey so far has been winding, wild and transformative to say the least, but it's taken me as far as to complete my master's in counseling, offer emotional healing to others, and stimulate my growth as a student, expanding my knowledge on wellness and other healing modalities. It's been nearly a decade since that yoga class and it seems only fitting to be able to give back through the practice that has been the gateway to my own healing.

The goal...

I was on a mission to find a yoga studio that had a great balance of challenging asana practice, a strong relationship to community, and spiritual connection and education. I found it all at Happy-U Yoga in OB with a unique positive psychology approach, bridging the gap between western and eastern understandings of wellness. (Those that know me, know I nerd out over positive psychology practices, so it was a plus.) I fell in love with this studio, the people, and overall, just had a good feeling about what opportunities they provided. The cost for yoga teacher training (YTT) is $2197. My goal is $3000 to cover the cost of training, materials such as books, and shipping costs for goodies I'm sending to you.

If we happen to make anything over that goal, I will donate to OG Yoga, a nonprofit organization who supports healing in vulnerable communities by teaching a trauma-informed curriculum to teachers and makes mindfulness and yoga practices accessible to those who wouldn't normally be able to take a yoga class. Please read up on them if you get a chance.

Side note: If you're in the San Diego area, check out Happy-U– they offer $5 drop in classes multiple times a week. Follow them on IG @happyuyoga for their schedule.

In gratitude..

To thank you for your support, I have a list of perks for you to choose from including exclusively designed wellness-inspired smartphone wallpapers, t-shirts designed by Colleen Grace (follow her on IG @ominbloom), and yoga sessions! All of the funds you donate will go towards YTT and your perks will be gifted to you regardless of whether the goal is met.

If you are unable to donate, I totally get it! I'm right there with you which is why I'm calling on community support. BUT if you could, please share this campaign via social media, email, and/or word of mouth.
story_txt:
Hi everyone!
Here's the short story...
Yoga is a gateway for many people to connect and understand the power within themselves. I am one of many who have felt the healing impact of yoga and mindfulness and have felt called to share it. I'm enrolling in Yoga Teacher Training and need a little support funding it. Through this experience, my academic knowledge of mental health and insight on healing, my goal is to share this mind-body practice to those who may find it to be inaccessible or exclusive and am committed to support equitable access to wellness. Please support by donating or sharing this campaign. To show my gratitude, each donor will receive a gift (redeem them in the perks section) and if by chance, we exceed the goal, I will donate to an amazing organization with a similar mission.
With love and gratitude,
Alyssa
Follow me on IG @alyssalilia or visit alyssalilia.com to connect.
Here's the long story...
At a young age, I was exposed to healing through my grandmother. She would "hilot" us through massage. It was one of her many trades. Sometimes, she would read my palm and give me insight. She taught me to dance, cook and simply to live life with meaning and take care of one another. When she passed, I was 17 and in college.  I grieved in ways that weren't healthy for me. And the cliche of "when it rained, it poured" manifested itself. My long term relationship ended and I lost my job within months of each other. That's a lot of emotions for anyone, let alone someone who just transitioned into adulthood. I had family support, friends, and ways to positively cope but my traumas seemed to haunt me including past experiences I had no idea I needed to deal with. In retrospect, this time in my life was the catalyst for my healing journey to truly begin. When I went home to spend time with family, I enrolled in a community college during summer break and was immersed in a beginning hatha yoga class. While I expected a physical practice, I did not expect the emotional and spiritual influence that it would have on me. The guided practice and the holding of our postures inspired reflection, heart-opening, truth and self-healing. All of which I've been craving ever since. The journey so far has been winding, wild and transformative to say the least, but it's taken me as far as to complete my master's in counseling, offer emotional healing to others, and stimulate my growth as a student, expanding my knowledge on wellness and other healing modalities. It's been nearly a decade since that yoga class and it seems only fitting to be able to give back through the practice that has been the gateway to my own healing.
The goal...

I was on a mission to find a yoga studio that had a great balance of challenging asana practice, a strong relationship to community, and spiritual connection and education. I found it all at Happy-U Yoga in OB with a unique positive psychology approach, bridging the gap between western and eastern understandings of wellness. (Those that know me, know I nerd out over positive psychology practices, so it was a plus.) I fell in love with this studio, the people, and overall, just had a good feeling about what opportunities they provided. The cost for yoga teacher training (YTT) is $2197. My goal is $3000 to cover the cost of training, materials such as books, and shipping costs for goodies I'm sending to you.
If we happen to make anything over that goal, I will donate to OG Yoga, a nonprofit organization who supports healing in vulnerable communities by teaching a trauma-informed curriculum to teachers and makes mindfulness and yoga practices accessible to those who wouldn't normally be able to take a yoga class. Please read up on them if you get a chance.
Side note: If you're in the San Diego area, check out Happy-U– they offer $5 drop in classes multiple times a week. Follow them on IG @happyuyoga for their schedule.
In gratitude..
To thank you for your support, I have a list of perks for you to choose from including exclusively designed wellness-inspired smartphone wallpapers, t-shirts designed by Colleen Grace (follow her on IG @ominbloom), and yoga sessions! All of the funds you donate will go towards YTT and your perks will be gifted to you regardless of whether the goal is met.
If you are unable to donate, I totally get it! I'm right there with you which is why I'm calling on community support. BUT if you could, please share this campaign via social media, email, and/or word of mouth.

story:
Bienvenue à toutes et tous ! 

Nous sommes trois sœurs, les 3 A – toutes trois aux alentours de la 30aine – issues de domaines d’expertises différents (santé, ingénierie et cognitique) qui avons l’opportunité – car nous ne croyons pas en la chance ? – de développer une boutique de bien-être au féminin à Bordeaux.  

Nous la voulons régie par des femmes, et focalisée sur le plaisir des femmes. C’est pourquoi le nom de « L’Impératrice » nous a paru comme une évidence !   

Notre particularité : en plus des traditionnels produits de beauté et de soins permettant de mettre en valeur notre esthétique, nous pensons qu’il est temps de se centrer sur notre entière féminité. Pour cela, nous souhaitons proposer une boutique dans laquelle nous nous sentirons en confiance, un espace où nous pourrons enfin nous découvrir ou aider nos conjoints à nous découvrir et explorer tous nos sens afin d’atteindre le bien-être.   

Que vous soyez célibataire en quête de plaisir personnel ; en couple en quête de développer d’autres sensations ; à la recherche d’ouvrages et d’ateliers vous permettant de vous reconstruire à la suite d’un traumatisme, vous êtes au bon endroit ! 

Il s'agit tout simplement de ramener de l’amour et du plaisir, sans aller les chercher ailleurs, en se les apportant à soi. 

Vous pourrez naviguer dans la boutique et découvrir nos huiles de massage, bougies d’ambiance, prêt-à-porter et lingerie raffinée, bijoux révélateurs, ouvrages d’éducation sexuelle et de prise de confiance en soi, œuvres d’art, ainsi que des accessoires pour explorer et développer votre sensualité et sexualité.  Nous proposerons également des ateliers de découverte et de rééducation avec des experts dans un environnement accueillant, stimulant et sans jugement.

Oublions le self-control, il est l’heure du self-pleasure sous toutes ses formes. Rendons sa puissance à la femme !  

Serez-vous de la partie avec nous ? 

Notre Besoin et Votre Rétribution

Nous partons de zéro donc c’est un gros investissement ! Et dû à un nombre impressionnant de refus de financement par les banques – pour qui le projet n'est pas en accord avec leurs image et réputation – nous nous tournons aujourd’hui vers la Communauté.  

Nous sommes en quête de 15750 €, répartis comme suit :

  • Caisse enregistreuse + logiciel de caisse / inventaire + terminal de paiement CB : 3,000 € 
  • Présentoirs et assises : 3,000 € 
  • Stock d'accessoires et de lingerie : 5,500 €
  • Cintres de présentation et sacs cadeau : 750 € 
  • Cabines d'essayage normes d'accessibilité : 750 € 
  • Consultant en communication : 2,000 €
  • Frais de plateforme de crowfunding : 750 €

L'Impact

Loin des tabous et des stéréotypes de la société, nous souhaitons rendre son pouvoir et sa confiance à la femme en lui permettant de retrouver sa partie décisive, audacieuse, séduisante et romantique. 

Comment Nous Aider Autrement

Participer financièrement n'est pas toujours possible, mais cela ne veut pas dire que vous ne pouvez pas nous aider: passez le mot et partagez dans vos réseaux !! Merci merci merci

***************************************************************************************

Welcome pleasure seekers, 

We are three sisters, "the 3 A's" – all around our 30’s – from different backgrounds (health, engineering, and human factors) who have the opportunity – we don’t believe in luck ? – and the passion to create a special feminine wellness boutique. 

We want it female-owned, female-run, and female pleasure-focused. Hence why the name of “L’Impératrice” (The Empress) seemed obvious! ? 

Our particularity:  in addition to the traditional beauty and care products, we believe it is time to focus on our full femininity. We want to offer a boutique in which we will feel confident, a space where we can finally discover ourselves or help our partners to discover us and explore all our senses to achieve well-being. 

Whether you are single looking for personal pleasure; a couple in search of other sensations; looking for books and workshops to help you rebuild yourself after a trauma, you have come to the right place! 

Self-love and self-care are our priorities. It is a simple matter of bringing back love and pleasure, without looking elsewhere but within. 

You will be able to browse through our boutique and discover massage oils, mood candles, sexy prêt-à-porter and exquisite lingerie, body jewelry as well as accessories, sexual education books and artwork. We want it to be a safe space to explore and develop your sensuality and sexuality. 

We will also offer discovery workshops with experts on sex education in a welcoming, stimulating, and non-judgmental environment. 

Forget about self-control, it is time for self-pleasure in all its forms.  

Let's redefine sexuality together on our own terms and empower women! 

So, will you join us? 

What We Need & What You Get

We are starting from scratch, so it is a massive investment! And after many refusals from banks to finance us – as “erotic” seems too damaging to their image and reputation – we want to try and see if you, the Community, would like to support us through crowdfunding. 

We are seeking 15,750 €, to be used as follows :  

  • Cash register machine + cash / inventory software + card payment terminal : 3,000 € 
  • Display furniture and seating : 3,000 € 
  • Stock of accessories and lingerie : 5,500 €
  • Hangers and gift bags : 750 € 
  • Fitting rooms with disabled access : 750 € 
  • Communication consultant : 2,000 €
  • Crowfunding platform fee : 750 €

The Impact

Let's remove taboos, reprogram negative restrictive ideals set by our society, and replace them with well-being. We wish to empower women by allowing them to retrieve their decisive, audacious, seductive, and romantic facets.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute financially, but that doesn't mean you can't help us: please spread the word as widely as possible! Thank you thank you thank you

story:
Win a Lifetime Membership

One lucky pledger on our T-shirts will be entered into a prize draw to win a Lifetime Membership to Freediving Lanzarote, including a course of his/her choice every year. This will allow you to join freediving training sessions whenever you want for FREE! To qualify you just need to pledge on any of our t-shirts. This is a reward not to be missed out on!
 

Enter our Referral Program

We are excited to announce that we've added a Referral Program which you can all join!
Get your friends to contribute, and receive training sessions or gift vouchers in exchange! View point 6  below on on how it works and start earning your next holiday!
 


1. Why Lanzarote?

Over the last 6 years we have trained and competed in 19 different countries around the world and we’ve chosen Lanzarote for our European venture. 

It exceeds most freediving expectations, such as water temperatures that enable us to train all year round, minimal water movement, unlimited depth and all that within a Government Protected Biosphere Reserve. Many experts consider Lanzarote’s dive sites to be the best in Europe, and it is known for its underwater museum - Museo Atlantico, a must see. 

Lanzarote is easily accessible from most European cities with more than 90 direct flights a day.


2. What is our idea?

Our goal is to create an amazing freediving location, where freedivers of all abilities and nationalities can come to meet and practice their passion all year round within a great and safe environment.

We are now expanding our Freediving Lanzarote project - to include a state of the art boat which will provide the ultimate safe freediving experience, and give the flexibility to access the best daily conditions and sites. Of course the boat is the vital component, but we will also have new customized onshore facilities at Puerto Calero Marina.
 

 

Puerto Calero provides a peaceful location where people can relax, get back in touch with nature, play, learn and explore. It is just a 15 minute drive from the airport and has a wide range of accommodation within the vicinity. 

Freediving Lanzarote Club and Centre will provide educational freediving courses, training and coaching sessions, specialist workshops, community events, annual freediving competitions and trips to Lanzarote’s best dive sites. 

Within a safe environment for beginners to progress, to high performance athletes, the center will help to grow the freediving stars of the future. Whatever your age or ability Freediving Lanzarote will be open to you.


3. Why Crowdfunding?

Freediving is about community, and we want freedivers to play an important role in this very ambitious project. This project is for you, our club members, friends and freedivers of today and those yet to come.

Funding this initiative will help build the purpose-designed freediving centre and purchase a rigid-inflatable boat with specialised safety equipment. Our plan is to have the operation up and running in February 2018.

We have set a goal of 50,000€ as a minimal target, but in reality we need more to complete it as imagined. 

With your support, we can build something really special that will last. That is why we have included the reward of having your name engraved within our "wall for posterity"! We want you to be part of our history and leave a permanent memory of your involvement.

If we're fortunate enough to exceed our goal, we would enhance our original ideas!


4. Team

We're lucky to have a team of global leaders in freediving. Learn more about who we are here.


5. Become part of our Community

Help us get the word out about the Freediving Lanzarote campaign by sharing the project with friends and family - simply press share buttons at the top of this page.

For the latest project updates, follow @freedivinglanzarote on Facebook and Instagram. You can reach us at freedivinglanzarote@gmail.com.

Show your support for Freediving Lanzarote and Contribute Now!

 

6. Enter our Referral Program

Share your passion for freediving and our project with your friends. Our referral prizes are a "Thank You!" for helping spread the word. Get your friends to contribute, and receive training sessions or gift vouchers in exchange!

Stay tuned each week as we announce those who have earned referral prizes!


Here is how it works:

  1. Log into your Indiegogo
  2. Click on the referral link the right of the campaign video.
  3. Share with your friends and/or via social media buttons to the right of the video.
  4. Make sure your friends use your unique referral link when they buy, so you get credit.
  5. You can check your account to see how many referral euros you have driven.
  6. Your friends must spend a combined total of €500 or more or €1000 or more to receive the prizes listed above.



How to track your progress:

Rules:

  1. You must be a contributor to the campaign.
  2. You will only get referral credit if you are logged in to Indiegogo, and share your personal referral link. Your friends must use this link to purchase their perk.
  3. You cannot receive more than one prize. Your final prize will be determined by the prize that is closest to your total referral contribution.
  4. Gift Vouchers can be used on all Freediving Lanzarote activites (courses, training, coaching sessions and trips).



Frequently Asked Questions

​​Q: How will I be able to book my courses, trainings or coaching sessions?
A: All services purchased will be added to your Freediving Lanzarote user profile, (linked to your email address) which you will be able to access visiting www.FreedivingLanzarote.com. From there, you will be able to book your courses, training or coaching sessions selecting dates from the integrated booking system. On completion of booking you’ll receive a confirmation email. The website will be up and running in February 2018.

Q: How are the freediving courses structured?

Q: What is included in the course price?
A: Within the course price is included: course materials, diving insurance, course certification and freediving equipment.

Q: What is the minimum age to enroll on a course?
A: The minimum age is 18 years old or older (16 or 17 years with parent or guardian consent).

Q: What is the difference between Coaching and Training sessions?
A: During Coaching sessions, you will be guided by an expert instructor and receive all the needed tips and tricks to improve your skills.
During Training sessions, you will join other freedivers to practice and improve independently. 

Q: What are the requirements to join for Coaching, Training or Trips?
A: To join for Coaching, Training or Trips you must be at least 16 years old and have an AIDA 2 Star certificate (or a corresponding qualification from another freediving organization).

Q: How can purchased Gift Vouchers be used?
A: Purchased Gift Vouchers can be used on all Freediving Lanzarote activities and retail products (also attracts 10% discount on all courses, training, coaching sessions and trips). It can be redeemed through booking online, email or phone. Gift Vouchers may not be exchanged for cash.

Thanks for your support and we look forward to seeing you at Freediving Lanzarote!



A special thanks to our corporate supporters!

It can be redeemed through booking online, email or phone. Gift Vouchers may not be exchanged for cash.Thanks for your support and we look forward to seeing you at Freediving Lanzarote!
